I did not experience any issues with the unit shutting off randomly, or any other major failures along those lines.The battery life is great on this unit, as I only charged the unit once when first received the camera, and after a few hours of testing, the camera still hasn't warned me of a low battery. The WiFi remote battery did die on me, but I did not charge that device all of the way. I spent most of the time using the iPhone APP. With that said, I did find the mounts included a bit inconvenient. I am used to the ease of use from the Monoprice MHD action cameras and the mounts that GoPro uses are all proprietary. I couldn't use any tripods, or accessories I already owned. I found this terribly inconvenient, as I had to borrow an adapter from a friend to mount it onto my roll bar.Mounted on my helmet, on the right side, just like how I mount to my Monoprice MHD Action cam, the GoPro stuck out almost 4 inches from the side of the helmet, almost 2 inches more than the MHD Action cam. This made the helmet want to lean to the side, and I could feel the cameras heft. I did not like this.Overall, the camera is a fine piece of machinery. I do not like the idea of being locked into the proprietary and bulky mounting system. I also no not like how the unit has a focal distance of about 4 feet. Anything beyond 4 ft is simply not in focus and is blurry. It seriously seems like it would be a factory defect, but after contacting GoPro directly, I have found that this was an intended change to the unit. It was to improve the quality of POV footage. I don't know  about most users, not I don't know any person who uses their GoPro for that kind of video, maybe only reality TV shows.On a 1-10 scale I rate this unit a 6. It may have the best features, and the highest framerates, but if it can't focus on my subjects, it is simply of no use to me.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade-worthy, focus is fine.
Reviews.Author: Y. R. Wu "The will to win is nothing without ...
Reviews.Content: Summary: If you have an older HERO2, it's time to upgrade....If you have a White/Silver HERO3, you should seriously consider the HERO3+ Black.I purchased my HERO3 Silver last year shortly after it came out.  At the time, I could get a HERO2 for a much lower price, even after adding WiFi.  I finally decided on the HERO3 Silver for the included dive-capable case (the HERO2 has a curved front which means your underwater footage is distorted)While I've been super happy with the HERO3 silver, I was doing the math on upgrading to the HERO3+ Black, so was super happy to have the opportunity to review it here.The features which were making me consider upgrading were:  1) Faster frame rate on Black (No change in HERO3+, but the Silver's 120 FPS wasn't enough)  2) Longer battery life.  I have a second Wasabi brand battery, but with the HERO3+ and Wifi off, I almost don't need it anymore!  3) More sensitive low light mode  4) SUPERVIEW mode  5) Smaller, lighter case with one handed open/close  6) Improved Wifi range / speedNote that the camera itself is the same size, but the new case is now only rated waterproof to 131 feet, where the prior case was rated to 197 feet.  If you plan to use it scuba diving at that depth, you'll probably need lights so an extra $50 for the sturdier housing probably isn't an issue.Whether you value these features depends on how you use the GoPro.  I do FPV Skiing, Mountain Biking, and then also record my daughters soccer games and swimming.  You can get a better look at the entire field with SUPERVIEW and record the whole game with the longer battery life.  Greater WiFi distance means I can control it from *almost* anywhere on the field (I typically put the camera above the goal or at the halfway sideline)The WiFi app on my Android phone can be buggy depending on when I go in and out of range or if my phone sleeps.  Reconnecting can be a pain.  It's indispensable for adjusting your view on a boom pole, and critical for making sure you have the camera aimed properly.Finally, there is a lot of chatter in the forums on the sharpness/focus of the HERO3+ (Google " Gopro Hero3+ image quality problem"). It *appears* that a relatively large number of the initial units were focused too closely - things that are perhaps 50 feet or more away are blurry.  To see if my unit was affected, I took pictures side by side with the HERO3 and HERO3+ and found that my HERO3+ unit was fine - even sharper on tree branches some 150-200 feet away.  GoPro seem to be indicating that the units should be sharper at ALL distances than the HERO3, not just for closer distances.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera....I own 3
Reviews.Author: Michael Gall
Reviews.Content: I have 3 of these and use them all at the same time.  They are fantastic life capturing devices...the simplicity  of these cameras is incredible.  I use on of these on my DJI Phantom 2 Quadcopter and it takes amazing videos from the sky... for the other 2 I have a variety of mounts and I love taking videos every where I go....I highly recommend getting one and seeing what exciting uses you can come up with for these.

Reviews.Title: Seems impressive but watch the card!! (UPDATE BELOW)
Reviews.Author: Vilmar Tavares "Seeker of Truth"
Reviews.Content: Only 4 stars now and you'll see why.  Hope to upgrade to five after I've used it a couple of weeks.I purchased this camera, two batteries and the SanDisk Ultra 32G card.  The camera arrived a day early and the other two on time.  Since I could do nothing until the card arrived I charged the battery and read the manual.  The next day I inserted the card and synched the remote.  I also downloaded the latest software update from the Go-Pro site and following their instructions to the letter I put the card back in, turned on the camera and waited for the update.Two hours later I was still waiting.  Lights were flashing, the indicator said updating was in progreess, etc.  But something was wrong so I called Go-Pro and talked to a tech.  He confirmed it should have taken a minute or two...tops.  So I pulled out the battery, pressed the On button and "select" button simultaneously and held them for 4 seconds.  Downloaded the update again except this time I manually created an UPDATE folder and after unzipping the downloaded file, put the 4 files in the folder.  Then I took the card out of the camera, re-formatted it and put the UPDATE folder on it.Back into the camera with battery and card, pressed the ON switch and ....nothing.  Literally.  This time no lights or anything.The tech recommended trying another microSD card but the only one I remembered having was an older version that, whereas would not have worked on the camera for filming, etc. since it was not fast or big enough, worked OK to upload the files.  Back into the camera, switched t on and BINGO!  It worked.Put the Sandisk card back in there and got an error message.  Turns out the Sandisk card was bad...for this camera. The tech mentioned they've been having lots of problems with those cards and recommended a different brand (can't remember now.)  The reason I don't is because I forgot I had another SanDisk 32G card in my tablet.  Out of curiosity I installed it and it worked!Here's the weird thing:  the card that did not work in the camera?  Works perfectly fine in my tablet now.  Go figure!!So was it the camera that's too finicky?  Can't seem to be the card as it works in other equipment.I haven't played much with the camera (it's raining cats and dogs) but the Android app works great.  Beats that tiny camera screen.  All the other features seem to work OK too for the little I tried it indoors.  Family's coming for Easter so I will be taking it kayaking and hope to grab underwater shots of manatees.  Will also play with the panorama-on-a-kitchen-timer trick.UPDATE:As promised here's the update.  I've upgraded to 5 stars as the SD card thing is more of a fluke than anything else.I'm very impressed by this camera. Took it swimming (buy a cheap monopod at Wal-Mart, hook it up, tie a string to the monopod and fling it in the water.  It floats lens down for unassisted filming.)  Did timer shots, regular snapshots, everything works as advertised.Buy a couple of spare batteries and you're good to go for hours.The Go_pro ap works really well on my tablet, too.

Reviews.Title: Sharp as a tack
Reviews.Author: ArtStream
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about poor infinity focus on the GoPro3+ Black Edition with horror. I'm touring India on MC for 4 months and ordered the 3+ with enough lead  time to pixel peep, expecting to return it if the unit showed any poor quality focus. I am delighted to report that my unit is sharp as a tack at all distances. I've set it up: 1040P, 47fps  and processed it using the GoPro  editing software. I'm impressed with the android app control and the remote control unit. I did notice some shutter during playback at higher  resolution  using a SanDisk Ultra 32 GB MicroSDHC C10/UHS1 Memory Card, and have ordered the Pro version of this card. Good luck and remember"The Journey IS the Destination"

Reviews.Title: GoPro Hero3 White
Reviews.Author: TeeHee
Reviews.Content: Great product. Works exactly as described. The extra remote from the black edition is definitely not necessary, especially for a snowboarder such as myself.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Brenda M.
Reviews.Content: greatest camera in the world the quality is amazing the case is like indestructible and going into the beach water and recording underwater or at the pool is amazing small portal but shows great pics and video just kinda have to guess but not that hard considering you can't look through the lense to see what your camera will capture if you took a pic but it worked out for me

Reviews.Title: Need to name them happy cam's
Reviews.Author: C H Johnson
Reviews.Content: First, be aware you can get a addiction to GOPRO cameras.This has about every thing as in it has about every function one could ask for in a camera. Just wish they had Camars like this when I young and still doing dumb stuff. Anyway it's and an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: GoPro Black 3+
Reviews.Author: George Davis
Reviews.Content: Great little camera I have used it a lot all ready and have a lot more plans for it this summer.

Reviews.Title: A must for adrenaline junkies
Reviews.Author: Alex Brayman
Reviews.Content: This is a must for any adventurous outgoing person. With the various mounts they make you can take this camera anywhere. I have footage of everything from snorkeling in the Bahamas to snowboarding in Vermont all in HD. This camera has filmed while underwater, in a pile of snow, at temperatures above 120F and even worked in -25F frozen environments (as long as you scrape the ice layer off the front before you start recording).  I have yet to have any problems with the camera and often bring it with me for random adventures because of its durability and size. When it is in protective casing it is VERY sturdy, outside the case I'd be afraid to drop it. The only drawback is when you forget your wearing a camera, sometimes you forget to stop recording. All in all a camera for the adventurous type.

Reviews.Title: Best action camera available, only wish it had better battery life
Reviews.Author: Z S Liske
Reviews.Content: In a world of action cameras this is the best. Video quality is superb and the accompanying free iPhone app works great. If you want an action camera with the best quality get the Black Edition. My only gripe is how fast the battery drains. This camera has WiFi and if you use it your battery will drain in under two hours. Be mindful and carry extra batteries. Also don't expect this to be on par with cinema cameras. This camera is great because of the size  form factor and versatility not because it can make you Steven Spielberg. Also the menus are a bit cumbersome and require some practice time before you go out and use it.

Reviews.Title: Best action camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Maryjane Arnett
Reviews.Content: This was the best gift I could give my husband! He loves it and uses it all the time! It takes such amazing footage! And the remote makes it so easy! It is amazing how the image is so steady. Also the quality of the footage blows my mind. We took it skiing on a snowy dark day and the footage came out beautifully! All of the mounts have worked great for us. I love how much such a tiny camera captures. The wide angle is great and doesn't create too much of a fishbowl at all.  We have gotten it soaked with no leaking in the housing. It's been skiing, kayaking, biking, we even attached it to our dog! Awesome toy for the outdoor enthusiast! Now onto makiing movies!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Especially for SCUBA
Reviews.Author: Best Game Ever
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for a SCUBA trip and it worked perfectly.  Even down to 120 feet the case kept everything safe and matched with a red filter (I used this one: http://www.amazon.com/GoPro-Hero3-Filter-Aqua3--GoPro-Accessory/dp/B00GWFX69Y/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid;=1395839877&sr;=8-2&keywords;=go+pro+red+filter) you'll have a great combo to go deep and get great video!  The battery life worked for me to go through two dives - as long as I remembered to turn it off between dives.

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool, but expensive and terrible battery life
Reviews.Author: Airbird9
Reviews.Content: I'll spare everyone another review about how cool the GoPro is. It takes shoots great video and is ruggedized.The waterproof housing can scratch easily, so get a lens replacement kit for the housing, if you can find a set in stock. I've been on back-order for a month now :o.The battery life is terrible. They can do better. Maybe it increases weight a bit, but it'd be well worth it.It's nice to have the new Super-wide View capability, though I've seen a lot of newbies confused by the fish-eye effect. They don't realize it's an inherent part of showing such a wide view on in smaller dimensions, and that it can be turned off at the time of shooting, or later removed in post-processing. I get so tired of seeing users with this confusion, as I also see it for other products that have wide field of views.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly Clear!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: The only thing I don't like is how choppily the thing plays back after filming it in 1080p. Using the GoPro software to edit is great, but the chopiness is still present. However, once you upload it to youtube, the choppiness is no longer present, and it looks great!

Reviews.Title: Very happy witht the newest version!
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I had the previous Hero 3 but it was lost in a lake. I decided to get the new Hero 3+ before going on vacation. I absolutely love it and would buy another in a heartbeat if I had to. The original had some freezing issues and I wasn't very happy with the battery life. This one hasn't given me any trouble and the videos/pictures turned out amazing. The new slim case looks a lot nicer as well.For those who don't know, the Hero 3+ is an upgraded version of the Hero 3. Everyone loved the camera when we were snorkling and many people said they will look into buying one when they get back. I took hours of videos and 1500 pictures in the past two weeks and didn't have a single issue with it.

Reviews.Title: Great in general
Reviews.Author: splitting
Reviews.Content: poor in los light condition so if you want to record night clips this is not for you , great in sunny days. Very good product in general

Reviews.Title: Buggy, unusable
Reviews.Author: Peter Fry
Reviews.Content: I was excited to try out the GoPro and planned to use it for a scuba diving trip. Fortunately I did not buy all the underwater accessories and tested the camera first. The camera did not work properly, seeming to have several issues.- Would not sync with iPad - the GoPro's Wifi signal only reached the IPad once in over 4 hours of trying to get the GoPro App working. Online support was horrible - they did send me an e-mail saying they'd get back in 24-48 hours. That was the last I heard from them- The battery did not appear to hold its charge even when the system was not in use- Updating the firmware is Byzantine unless you're a tech wiz- The picture - I did manage a few seconds of video - was only OK - the focus up to a few feet was reasonable but background was blurred. The video was quite jumpy too.My GoPro had to be sent back - I think I had a defective unit but after several hours of trying to get it working I decided not to replace and to go with a still camera instead.

Reviews.Title: Worked well for three weeks, now won't charge
Reviews.Author: K Morris
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my husband.  It worked well for bicycling around town and one skiing trip, but now it won't charge.  None of the LEDs light up when we connect the USB cable.  I am currently trying to work through the issue with GoPro customer support, but it looks like we will have to return it.

Reviews.Title: Unique
Reviews.Author: E. Allison
Reviews.Content: Excellent video quality ... less so audio ... the menus will wear you out but there are several useful controls and only one way to get to them ... small, light, and fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Interesting observations now that I have it.
Reviews.Author: Eric B.
Reviews.Content: The case that comes with it is yes smaller and lighter. It does how ever seem less durable but I think it will be fine. The glass lens protector is much more vulnerable to damage. Its pretty much out there. The # has a lip around it so if you were to for example place it lens down on a surface, it wouldn't make contact. The 3+ would. The extra and replacement cases are quite expensive. But on a good note. The camera's. The 3 and the 3+ are virtually the identical size. I realize they are different in capabilities, but size wise there identical. Which means, and Ive tried it out, that you can interchange cases. If youd like to accessorize your 3+ with cheaper options that are marketed for the 3 you can, or if you prefer the smaller lighter cases for the 3+ you could use them with your 3. Everything fits and lines up the same.  The 3+ cases are just smaller, thinner, lighter. And they do have a simpler latching system. Instead of the push to the side and pull back simultaneously and bash your fingers the first few times you use it  until you master it. They have a simple common latch. Super spendy though. I will definitely accessorize with Hero3 cases. They seem more durable, cheaper to buy and if needed maintain. Image quality and usability of course is as expected from GoPro. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: GoPro is best of the best
Reviews.Author: Geoff Bowman
Reviews.Content: I don't need to talk up GoPro... they've cut a name for themselves out already.  I tried to go for a cheaper Midlands action cam but I returned it after one day of use because nothing beats these guys.  Here's what I use it for:-underwater filming (mount it on scuba gear and film the whole experience worry free!)-using the gopro iOS app I can set this up as a video baby monitor plugged into the wall and keep an eye on my son while he plays or sleeps... if he starts doing something cute I can even start recording without disturbing him or missing it.  Could also make a decent security camera if you're in wi-fi range.-using the head strap harness I can take video of playing with my son and still have both my hands free.-same thing but with playing piano so I can observe my finger movements later and work out some kinks in my practice.-takes good photos on the go-takes some awesome sunrise time lapsesI'd recommend if you're using any audio from the camera that you buy the skeleton housing too as the waterproof one doesn't really pick up anything but extremely loud or extremely close audio.  There is no comparison to any other action cam in this price range though.

Reviews.Title: Made my husband's Christmas!
Reviews.Author: gail butler
Reviews.Content: My husband was thrilled with this gift for Christmas.  He will use it as he takes motorcycle trips this summer.

Reviews.Title: Oh my god..
Reviews.Author: Kristopher Rattansingh
Reviews.Content: That is the only way I can put it. This little bugger packs a punch, works great in low light, protune is a delight. Could not ask for anything more than better battery life.

Reviews.Title: Completely blown away...
Reviews.Author: Stuart Wilson
Reviews.Content: Got this as a long awaited gift. Everything I wanted in an "action" type camera. Some accessories can be rather expensive, in stores, so your best bet is to find them online or here on Amazon. its very easy to get used to, only has 3 physical buttons, fairly simple user manual also. If your getting it for someone who is NOT tech savvy, I recommend you do the settings for them.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic.  Everyone should have one
Reviews.Author: Suze
Reviews.Content: This little camera has jumped out of an airplane, sailed over a cliff into the ocean, wake boarded, snow boarded, kite boarded, and paddle boarded.  And all I had to do is watch these adventured  on my iPad home.  My son enthusiastically said it was the best gift I have ever given him!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: cody reiher
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too sure if it was going to be any good, but when i got it ive done nothing but film. the quality is amazing, the size is amazing the whole camera is just amazing.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever.
Reviews.Author: Old Musik Luver
Reviews.Content: One may want to sit in a good chair and read all the manuals prior to going out and taking video or shooting photos.  The camera is fairly easy to use but you need to what buttons do what.  The photos are great, the video is clear.  If you shoot video alone I would recommend getting the bac pac so you can see what you are shooting.  Excellent product which should last many years.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Russell H. POST IV
Reviews.Content: Amazing piece of equipment!!! So many things you can do with it. I use it for daily driving, hunting, and my vacations. Superb quality.

Reviews.Title: Unbeliavable amazing!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Castro
Reviews.Content: Not only the ship way very fast, but this camera is something Crazy! Bought just before a trip do Asia and it couldnt be better! Amazing quality of image and so easy to carry around. The app and the easy use of it just drives me crazy! I easily recommend this camera in any ways possible, from travelling to daily basis use!

Reviews.Title: I loved it.
Reviews.Author: Braulio Marval
Reviews.Content: It is by far the best action camera ever made. The diference between this and the black edition is the 4K and 2.7K recording, but if you haven't got a 4K monitor or TV you will not apreciate the difference. (And this cost 100$ less)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Video
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Sackett "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I am using this attached to a DJI Phantom 2 with gimbal.  I am really impressed with the quality of video and stills this little camera produces.  Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: No problems with depth of field
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I've used the camera so far for indoor test shots, videoing other cyclists outdoors with it on my helmet and mounted to the outside of a car.  The fields of view are great and there doesn't seem to be the depth-of-field issue others have reported - the image is sharp for close-up subjects and the background.The supplied remote works well and the connection to the GoPro app on an Android phone is an excellent feature.

Reviews.Title: Truly awesome
Reviews.Author: Janice R
Reviews.Content: Having had the original GoPro Hero HD camera, which was absolutely awesome when it was purchased, this Hero 3+ has gone far past what the original offered.  With all of the extra features and accessories, this camera is the perfect sports camera for whatever you do.  Our primary use of the GoPros is for filming drag racing passes.  This is the very best camera for fast action.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: David Renfro
Reviews.Content: Wish they included an SD card. Why package something that cannot be used out of the box? this is 2014, get with the times!

Reviews.Title: 3+: Definitely much better than 3
Reviews.Author: Sinanko
Reviews.Content: I have used every GoPro Hero that came out and for some reason Hero3 was the worst. It needed constant firmware update because it froze too much. The battery life was too short. There was huge lag when connecting it to my smartphone. GoPro seem to handle these very well with 3+. The battery life is muuuuuch longer, longer than I wanted. During my trip to Thailand, I used it extensively and althought I shot all day the battery was not dead. Wifi is almost instantly live but the problem was when I put the camera in the pool, there was no preview. The connection was lost in some cases. That might be a point of improvement. The casing is much better and the new clip is much easier to open; I hated the old one.All in all, cameras are at its best when you dont think about them. You just go out and use them and they don't make any trouble and you shoot whatever you want to shoot. This is exactly what Hero3 didnt do and Hero3+ does. A clear improvement.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Bradley Fuller
Reviews.Content: Now that GoPro have fixed the focus issue, this camera is brilliant. Sharp, clear and the colour is great. I liked the WiFi Remote inclusion except I find that it is a bit too dark. If there was a backlight on the remote that would be great. The WiFi range has improved a lot. I connected my phone to the camera and I had to walk out of the house and down the road before it started to cut out. A great camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy
Reviews.Author: Jason Mariano
Reviews.Content: I’m a motocross guy and this is key for me. I really enjoy how easy it is to use. The one thing I wish they would put in the deal is a hard case or the wrist band for the remote. Overall I love the  purchase. I do have the Hero 1 and 2 the 3 is legit !Thanks !

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Fletcher
Reviews.Content: The wide angle lens and high-def, high fps framerate make this a great camera, especially for it's size. Throw in the underwater housing, and (FREE) remote control app (iOS & Android) and this thing is awesome!!  I'm taking mine snowboarding in a week, hoping to look like the pros, will be happy to look like a high-def amateur..  XD

Reviews.Title: Excellent action camcorder.
Reviews.Author: Erich Maria Remarque
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camcorder with excellent video quality. I paired it with a 32GB Class 10 memory card.I attached it to the front of my car and went for a few drives (I like to record certain paths I typically frequent before I move away from somewhere). I used the skeleton backdoor camera housing and the video/sound quality is excellent (not much relevant sound though).I charged the battery and have used it for a few hours now. No low battery message so far.The looks are a little antiquated (monochrome display is so 90s :p ), but it doesn’t really matter since it’s going to be attached somewhere.The app is excellent. I like the fact that I can see and record things from an entirely different room. The Android app works great with my HTC Evo V 4G.Overall, I think this is a truly excellent device.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!  Lightweight, convenient, great video and still pictures.  Durable.
Reviews.Author: Crownan
Reviews.Content: We just took this to Hawaii and loved it.  Didn't find it on Amazon and ended up picking it up at Best Buy vending machine.Takes GREAT video & pictures and is pretty durable.  Doesn't come with head or chest harness that needs to be picked up separately.  Instructions on how to use hookups provided not completely clear.We used the chest harness (bought separately) which fit me (with a squeeze) and the kids.  Great shots of diving and surfing. Recommend you remind the kids (or yourself) to look at each other while doing activities.  Having someone's constant perspective while doing the activity was neat.Downloading to the laptop was really easy.  Looking forward to editing the footage.

Reviews.Title: Just As Good As the Previous Version But...
Reviews.Author: Shawn Kovacich "Shawn Kovacich"
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this camera was, like several other reviewers, a bit mixed and primarily so due to the fact that although the up-close viewing is quite crystal clear, the distance shots are not as precise and clear as the previous camera. I found this to be a bit annoying, but for the uses I have for these cameras it actually turned out to be a definite plus as I have and will continue to use this particular camera as a "Close-Up Only" camera and will use my other two GoPro Hero3 Black Edition cameras for my distance shots.Everything else about this camera, and I do mean everything else, is simply outstanding and I had no issues whatsoever with any of the features or functions of this camera. Although it is a bit smaller than the previous version, all the functions and features are identical in their use. I can use the same batteries and SD cards as my other two cameras.If you are looking for a great all-around action camera, go with the GoPro Hero3 Black Edition and let this one be. However, if you are going to be doing a lot of close-up work I would recommend this version. Heck, better yet if you can afford it buy one of each.

Reviews.Title: Still the best action cam, but may not be an improvement over the Hero3 for everyone
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: A lot of what applies to the older Hero3 applies to this as well. The image quality is very good - but this one seems to focus closer - objects beyond 5 ft are less sharp. There are a lot less issues using this than with the Hero3 when it was first released, out of the box.GoPro claimed that they've reduced the side, and increased battery life. They also claimed to have made it sharper. This is somewhat accurate. Let's examine the claims.Reduced size : the size reduction is from a smaller case. The camera is the exact same size. The new case is smaller and less tricky to open. The downside of that is that it is not rated for as deep in water as the old case. You can, however, use the old case if you happen to have one. Since the camera is the exact same size, there are no issues using the old case.The new case has another different issue : the backdoor for the battery pack or LCD screen will not fit the new case. GoPro appears to be working around this issue by shipping the old case with the battery back pack and LCD screen.If you have filters that clip on to the outside of the case, you're out of luck. The size is different, so filters (usually macro, polarizing, and red / magenta filters for underwater use) will no longer fit. The old cover for the housing will not fit the new housing. You will need to get the new version of the caps and doors, which adds a transparent glass cover for the lens, and costs twice what the old one costs.Better battery life : I tested this by running a test with both the old and new camera, at 1080p and ProTune. The old one died after about 1:35 and the new one went on till slightly over 2 hours. I then swapped batteries (they're interchangeable) and tested. The increased life comes from both a slightly larger battery (10% improvement) and a more efficient design (20% improvement). The camera still feels quite warm when in use.Sharper : close image appears to be sharper. Beyond 5 ft, it is less sharp, and beyond 20 ft the difference is quite pronounced. This has generated a lot of unhappiness among those who fly the GoPro on drones. The effect is also more pronounced when it is not sunny, and when shooting at a higher frame rate (smaller aperture when there is more light = greater depth of field). In the forums, many of the drone flyers have switched back to the older Hero3.Some users in the forums have reported that they are sending back their camera to GoPro for adjustment. Some reported improvements, other reported no change. As GoPro has not made an official announcement, I don't know if the closer focus is by design or a manufacturing issue. A few brave users have taken apart their camera to adjust focus, but I definitely do not advise taking that route. Best case : voided warranty. Worst case : dead camera without warranty,I've also noticed that the photos produced by the 3+ is half the size of the 3. GoPro is addressing this with a firmware update that "fixes a bug which could cause over-compression of photo files".Wifi performance may have been improved, but I did not test that extensively. Preview video lag is about 1 second, which is an improvement over the Hero3.One additional mode is added. It records more vertical resolution to get more of the scene in view. It appears to do this by recording in 1440 lines, then compresses this to 1080 lines. Aspect ratio is a little messed up as a result, but you do get a better view of, say, someone standing. If you don't mind doing post processing, you may want to record in a higher resolution (either 2.7k or 1440p) and do the compression yourself, or crop, as needed.In conclusion, the only question about this camera is the close focus. If that is not an issue to you, or if GoPro fixes this subsequently, it'll be a 5 star product. The older Hero3 has a shorter battery life, but is also $70 less expensive, which makes it a very compelling value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Horrid camera for diving, choose another.
Reviews.Author: Ashley Lout
Reviews.Content: So I got the Hero3+ for a dive trip in Belize. It was an easy use device and the first dive went without a hitch. Understand you must remove it from the housing in order to charge it. So dive 2 I go to turn it on and notice it won't activate, then I notice a bubble inside the housing. The seal failed after 1 dive, it gives no warning and  go pro doesn't warranty it as they blame it on the user. The problem lies in the poor clip design puts pressure on the bottom of the housing first. The seal wears so poorly it will simply loosen where you can't use it. My end result was this is a $400, one use camera. It is NOT a good camera for diving, choose  another. btw- my max depth was 81 ft for those that think I exceeded the limits, it failed at 40ft.

Reviews.Title: Excellent when it does not corrupt the videos!
Reviews.Author: Brad Hutchinson
Reviews.Content: Overall when this camera works correctly it is a remarkable piece of equipment.  My childhood was filmed using enormous VHS recording camcorders, followed by the VHS-C, and Mini DV all of which took horrible quality videos compared to something as tiny as the GoPro it is truly a huge technological wonder.  I use this camera primarily in 1080/60P narrow mode and do not like any of the wide angle fisheye looking modes.  Video quality is excellent for the size and when used in correct situations.  The GoPro is made for action and use in places where you would not risk using another camcorder in my opinion.  I would never mount my Panasonic HD camcorder underneath my car or take it underwater for instance but I do it with the GoPro rather frequently.  The underwater housing works well both underwater and to protect the camera from rocks and things when driving down the road.  One thing I wish they would offer on the next model is the ability to take the highest MP photos without it having to be the stupid wide angle mode.My reason for a negative review is that this camera consistently gives me corrupt videos.  Before you type me a smart comment saying the issue is my memory card and that I am an idiot read on.  I am well aware of the counterfeit memory cards causing problems that is not my issue.  I have multiple Sandisk Extreme Micro SD cards that I use with this camcorder which have all been purchased from reputable retailers and all pass testing with both H2testw and Flash Drive Tester with no errors whatsoever on read or write.  All of the memory cards work flawlessly in other devices I own as well.  Every time I use them in the GoPro however I get at least one corrupt video usually within the first 60 minutes of videos.  The videos transfer to the computer as mp4 they just have no thumbnail image and they are not playable.  I have tried transferring them using Adobe Premiere Elements 10, GoPro Studio, and simple dragging and dropping off the memory card onto the computer they are corrupt either way.  My GoPro has never been knocked off or stopped recording due to damage or battery life running out.  There is no message on the GoPro after recording saying it is fixing the video.  I have contacted GoPro support about the problem since the camcorder is less than 3 months old but they are useless.  All they will tell me is that the problem has to be the memory card and will not take the camcorder back or exchange it I have been going back and forth with them for a while now it is like talking to a wall.  At some point if I get a properly working camera I will revise my review but as of now due to the loss of numerous videos with no solution in sight this is not trustworthy enough of a device to recommend to anybody.  Luckily I use this device for somewhat unimportant things and have not lost anything critical.

Reviews.Title: GoPro Zero3+
Reviews.Author: Acmelabz
Reviews.Content: The Software Suite does not work well with this model. It does not recognize the camera. The camera refuses to turn off until the battery is either removed or depleted. Very frustrated with this camera. Would love to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: Improved from GoPro HERO3 version
Reviews.Author: Henri Savin
Reviews.Content: I loved my GoPro Hero3 although it had a few drawbacks.For instance it was running very hot with time, the battery life was not very good and it would sometimes lock.I still loved it because it was excellent for what it was designed for.Now here is the newer version of it. I tested it and here are the improvements:- Battery life is of about one hour now, compared to 30-45mn... It is a fair improvement.- Waterproof case is smaller. Not by much but still smaller.- At the end of the hour of shooting a video, the case was pretty hot. Not enough to burn myself but hot nonetheless.- It has some new video modes which I have not tried yet.Apart from that, here are the pros and cons I found about it:Pros:- Excellent video images- Waterproof and rugged design- Tiny- Remotely piloted by either a wifi device or an Iphone app.- Plenty of accessories available- Perfect for any sport activity- Nice photo quality, nice time lapseCons:- Still runs hot after a while (not an issue for underwater pictures)- Not meant for tourism since there is no LCD panel. One can buy one thought but it is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: Crap Camera - low low quality control
Reviews.Author: finout
Reviews.Content: I was one of the unlucky few to get a faulty camera, my first gopro purchase.  Ordinarily I would just replace it because Amazon returns are so easy, and I would forgive that and write a review of the replacement. Not this time.It killed a 64GB microsd card that had been working just fine.  Sure, I can get that replaced under warranty, so no actual harm done - except for the hassle and the nightmare of the return through Sandisk and being without the card for a month.I will avoid gopro products.  They have great design, cool accessories, and good quality when they work.  However, their software and/or manufacturing is some of the worst out there.

Reviews.Title: GoPro Blocked GPS lock on Blade 350qx
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Wicks
Reviews.Content: Sent this back.  Unit created enough RF transmissions that it would not allow my Blade 350QX get GPS lock.  Would not fly with unit attached and turned on. Take the Gopro off and it flies great.  So what is the sense?  Blade said that they are aware of this problem and that it does not happen with every GoPro

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Gave this to daughter for spring break . She loves it . It records great and we have great videos of her pars-sailing and deep sea fishing . She keeps thinking of new ways to use it also. Get one to share your experiences with friends and family !

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: After paying so muchI don't expect gopro to send defective picesOr is it the seller I don't knowI  was in a 10ft pool the water seeps in from the so called waterproof caseWas lucky that I was not in pool for long timeVery disappointed

Reviews.Title: Great plaything!
Reviews.Author: Janet
Reviews.Content: Son got this to film some of his college engineering projects. It's been underwater, up a tree, on the birdbath, in the rain, etc. Takes great video and seems very versatile - especially if you get the tripod that lets you wrap the camera around everything. He has had great fun with it, plus produced video for classes and projects he is working on.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for unique perspective
Reviews.Author: Monsoon
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Wifi allows you to see what you're shooting. Also allows for video control- Small size fits in pockets and areas that won't allow the camera to come into harm (exterior of vehicle)- Waterproof housing works perfectly- Easy to transfer videos- Expandable micro SD card memory slot allows for many recordingsCons:- Battery life dwindles down to about 3 hours max when using WiFi constantly- The camera gets very hot in the waterproof housing- Set-up takes a little time to understand, but once mastered, it's like playing with an old toy

Reviews.Title: Awesome Buy
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: i take it everywhere i go, films great. i normally do 1080p which films at 29.97 fps or so. which isn't THAT bad but you do notice the lag when you switch it to 720p at 60 frames lol. dramatic difference but i like the better quality of 1080p, perfect for what i do within budget. bought the gopro frame for it which was a huge difference in sound quality and size. still sturdy enough to drop a few times and take a shock or two. definately would recommend it to those vloggers out there like me who use it outside alot and would hate to have the sound go to crap because of the housing it comes with! thanks gopro for a quality product.there are a few cons about the battery freezing up that i saw people complain about. yes it does do it rarely but all you gotta do is just undo the battery from the back and plop it back in and it starts back up. i leave my wifi off because it drains the battery SO Bad. extremely fast. and without a battery pack of some sort to keep it charged while filming. it will die within an hour of continuous  filming.

Reviews.Title: best deal
Reviews.Author: susanhr19
Reviews.Content: this camera  came HIGHLY recommended and  was given as a graduation from college gift. it was so easy to operate he had it up and working in ten minutes. plus all the accessories were purchased also .this was a GREAT deal great delivery time thank you .

Reviews.Title: amazing camera
Reviews.Author: G. Smith "therev"
Reviews.Content: bought this to go with my DJI Phantom quad copter. I also use it on my motorcycle helmet. With just a little learning, it's doing GREAT!

Reviews.Title: My 12 year old child loves it!
Reviews.Author: F. Joiner "D. Joiner"
Reviews.Content: Got this for my 12 year old. After 30 minutes, he was filming his own movies and I have to say they look great. HD is really nice and the wifi makes everything so smooth.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: Paulina Vargovich
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I literally take it everywhere mountain biking, kayaking, four-wheeling.  Any chance I see to take my gopro hero 3 i take it.  It has amazing video and audio quality.  It is sleek and easy to assemble onto a helmet or any other device.  I recommend this camera for anyone who adores the outdoors or adventures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: It is simple this thing rocks the video world.  Never before has so much power been packed in such a small package.

Reviews.Title: Pristine Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: This GoPro edition is absolutely amazing in terms of sharpness, battery life, and low light capabilities. I'm stunned how low the noise/grains when I played some of my night shots in my 32" monitor. I was able to rig in in my DJI phantom drone and I'm surprised the wobbling effect is absent unlike the other previous versions of GoPro.This is the best gadget I have! However, I wished that the 120 fps was in 1080p, it could've been so awesome but it's okay because up-scaling it to 1080p doesn't hurt the sharpness so much so it's still good. I'm so amazed with it and it's totally worth the price. I will definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: gadget geek
Reviews.Content: This is miles better than the older GoPros. Image quality is fantastic. Fiddly controls and cable ports make it tricky to operate and to know when it's recording or not.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: james fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: Using it for aerial photography with a UAV. I rated it almost perfect, but would like more features regarding the images.

Reviews.Title: Best Cinema Quality video at low cost!
Reviews.Author: Jai
Reviews.Content: It's a really good camera all features work really good but it does have a problem of a shaky video but you can figure out how to stabilize it pretty good once you have some experience using it.

Reviews.Title: Very Useful
Reviews.Author: Jake S
Reviews.Content: Camera has great options for getting a wide angle view.I use it on a helmet while riding through woods and other dirty dusty conditions. The waterproof case does a great job of keeping out the elements.I love this thing!

Reviews.Title: Excellent compact camera!
Reviews.Author: Scotty S. "ss_imaging"
Reviews.Content: Excellent all the way! Watch out for yhe unfocused gopros, I bought one and it was blurry and not very sharp, returned it and swapped it for a new production date built one. It's excellent, super sharp and infinite focus all the way! I shoot 30 photos every 2 seconds and I also shoot hd and 240p vids!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, not great usability.
Reviews.Author: Cesar M Villalobos M
Reviews.Content: GoPro really hit the nail in the head as far as mounting versatility goes. Image quality is very good also. But battery life is very short. User interface is not friendly, but doable.I bought this camera to use on a plane and record my flying videos. Wifi reception is very weak. Mounted outside and bring 5ft away I can no longer control it with my iPhone or remote.

Reviews.Title: Waiting for a Long Time For This One
Reviews.Author: gch3
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to get a GoPro for a very long time.  Finally, I got it and I am happy that I went with the newest and top of the line Hero 3+ Black.  It appears to be everything I wanted in a camera.  I look forward to putting together some fun material.

Reviews.Title: It does what it claims
Reviews.Author: Daniel Versiani Ferreira
Reviews.Content: Excelent build. Feels like its going to last. I wish it came with more accessories thou. I guess there is nothing more to add.

Reviews.Title: Hero 3
Reviews.Author: Christopher Hutton
Reviews.Content: These are not the cameras for people looking to zoom in.  They are the action sports camera for close up awesomeness that give you high quality.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS!
Reviews.Author: B. Aguirre
Reviews.Content: Totally worth the investment, this camera has let us take amazing pictures and videos and we make sure to bring it on every trip. The only real downside is the battery life, but it has the capability to plug it in while you're using it, so I can't even complain. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: bust helmet cam out there
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: this camera records video of my snowmobiling dirt biking wake boarding and I'm even mounting it to my chainsaw for my job at field of screams. the 1080p video is awesome!

Reviews.Title: worked great skiing
Reviews.Author: ChallengerRT "ChallengerRT"
Reviews.Content: Seems to work great.  Brought to breckenridge and used a battery or 2 a day.  Using a 32gig card is a little small for a full day of skiing.

Reviews.Title: GoPro Hero3+
Reviews.Author: Tania Hornick
Reviews.Content: Camera has been great so far, as our other GoPro Hero 2 decided to stop working while on our holiday.  Delivered very quickly to our hotel.  Great service thank you.

Reviews.Title: Top of the line
Reviews.Author: Techie
Reviews.Content: This camera functioned even better than I had expected.  The videos were better than expected.  The other functinality: burst stills, time lapse, several video resolutions, and the WiFi, of this camera make it extermely difficult to beat.  The WiFi function makes it easy to control the camera and to view the photos and videos.

Reviews.Title: Boyfriend loves it.
Reviews.Author: jessica
Reviews.Content: I had bought this for my boyfriend for christmas, and he absolutely loves it. He can hook it up to an app on his phone. and it works really well, and has good quality.

Reviews.Title: Adds to the fun of traveling
Reviews.Author: Mitch Rosefelt
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for use on a bike trip in Vietnam.  We got some great pix using a handlebar mount and also when snorkeling.The wide angle lens causes some pix to be unusably distorted, but I didn't dock the GoPro a star for that - its part of the price for having such a versatile camera.The docked star is because we did have trouble charging the batteries - both in the camera and with a (3rd party) charger.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: malcolm prante
Reviews.Content: excellent little camera. already been surfing with it on a head strap. sweet deal with the app to transfer video straight to your phone. love it.

Reviews.Title: it's my second goPro video camera and I love it.
Reviews.Author: Avelarder
Reviews.Content: I got my gopro hero 3+ black edition few months ago and I can tell you it's an amazing product. better low light performance, remote control easy to setup, connect and use. Smaller body compared with my old gopro hero 2.Here is my unboxing video in case you want to see what's included in the box.[...]Hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: GoPro upgrade
Reviews.Author: Michael Chang
Reviews.Content: Very good upgrade from my previous generation. Better audio and video! My videos are sharper and audio is cleaner. I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Thomson
Reviews.Content: I took this out of the box and immediately to the North Shore for mountain biking with the handlebar seatpost mount and it was brilliant.  the images are great and not too shaky. With the downloadable software, I was able to pick a great camera angle using the wifi feature with my blackberry and the online software for video editing is easy and great for amateurs like me

Reviews.Title: Awesome and Versitile
Reviews.Author: Don Ehre
Reviews.Content: The GoPro Hero 3 is easy to operate in the standard video and photo modes and takes excellent pictures even in less than optimal light conditions.  Besides using it for recording sports and recreation, it could be a nanny cam, although the red flashing light will need to be covered.  Take it anywhere use it either in the protective case or as a camera without the case.

Reviews.Title: GoPro HERO3+: Black Edition
Reviews.Author: Sandy S "Sandy S"
Reviews.Content: I recieved this as a Christmas present and although I haven't used it a whole lot, it seems to be a fairly impressive little camera. I just wish there was a photo/video display screen on the back. If you are new to the GoPro and don't know where to start, I found some very interesting and informational videos on youtube ... just search for the user:  MicBergsma

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for HD video
Reviews.Author: Roger P.
Reviews.Content: Totally what I needed. I thought it was easy to use, Amazon delivered a day early. I took 450Gig of video on Vacation and it worked perfectly!!!  1080p at 60fps is awesome!!!  Got 1.5 hours of battery life at this setting which is in line with Gopro stats. Recommend you purchase extra batteries. Purchase the recommended memory chips on the Gopro site or you will have issues with recording video at these frame rates.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: I DON'T KNOW WHY I WAITED SO LONG TOO GET ONE , THESE ARE AWESOME AND A LOT OF FUN , EASY TO USE SHOOTS EXCELLENT VIDEO JUST LIKE YOU WHERE LOOKING OUT YOUR OWN EYES .THE USES FOR THIS ARE ENDLESS, BUT I DO RECOMEND GETTING ALL THE ACCESORIES RIGHT A WAY , YOUR GOING TO WANT THEM ANYWAY

Reviews.Title: Super View
Reviews.Author: sachin
Reviews.Content: This is awesome  productGot shipped in 2 days  with amazon Prime .Pros : Great Super View, 4k is awesome  , light weight, complete water resistance , I am selling my fish eye lens after getting this product. Simple operating functions , iPhone app is best option .Cons: Battery life is not good , camera hangs sometimes when Wi-FI on. Wifi dose not work under water . Dose not comes with SD card and this camera dose not have internal memory .Suggestions :  Must buy extra battery , tripod mount, suction cup. selfie monopod .

Reviews.Title: No better product
Reviews.Author: JV
Reviews.Content: I've been looking to buy a GoPro for some time now. I have to say that it has met and surpassed my expectations of quality and versatility. I have so much footage already I don't have the time to process and produce it all. Can't say enough to recommend this little toy.

Reviews.Title: A whole new world of photography
Reviews.Author: Jerry P. Reid "jpr"
Reviews.Content: I mount this on my bike.  it is a fascinating view of the world.  At Christmas, it was placed on top of a cabinet, taking pictures every few seconds.  One gets the various views of the people that are quite revealing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome all around video Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Schmidlin
Reviews.Content: Excellent Quality, this camera out performs my mini digital video recorder. I am definitely going to buy another one to broaden my experience. With the ability to control up to 50 cameras with 1 remote, and the cinema quality high resolution, this camera is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: Wifi drains battery at night.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Wifi was running constantly and even when turned off had to go in manually and change it through the camera settings. The battery would be fully charged at night, then in the morning it was dead. Ran the 'recommended' software update but still didn't work. Don't use the wifi button on the camera to turn it off. Go in the settings itself in the camera and turn it off.

Reviews.Title: High quality
Reviews.Author: Ronaldo
Reviews.Content: Who knows the great pictures and gopro videos has no doubt: This camera is wonderfull...I'm pleased to this purchase! Great!

Reviews.Title: Bought two plus add-ons for my two boys - HS and College.
Reviews.Author: Kyle Richards
Reviews.Content: I think this is a wise investment in that I'm able to collect family video while they're out having fun, and I'm not lol...It's been 3 weeks and I've heard no complaints from either son so these must be working fine.One of my best ideas in a while.Update + 3 weeks;  I've downloaded several hours of video and grade this lil camera high Marks.  I'm impressed with its inherent means to prevent jitter and promote video quality.  Darn good price I think for what it provides....I agree with reviewers penning positive reviews here.Kyle

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA EVER!!
Reviews.Author: James Perkins
Reviews.Content: The new gopro hero3+ is a major improvement from the hero 3. It is much smaller and lighter so you don't feel like someone's pulling your head to the ground every time you put it on your helmet or head. It shoots a much bigger picture than the 3. It has a super view. It shoots much better quality and clarity. The sound quality is much better and clearer than before because it cuts down on wind noise. It comes with a wireless remote and built in wireless to the camera. The case it comes in is much lighter and is waterproof up to greater depths compared to the 3. The case is also shock resistant and it's very durable. I've personally dropped mine from 8ft on to a hard floor and nothing happened to the camera or the case. I watched the video of the camera dropping and it was very clear and cool to watch. This camera all around is a very good camera. I've used it many times on my dirt bikes and it held up very well from the rocks, dirt and branches hitting it. The mounts keep the gopro stuck to the helmet very well. Through all the rocks and branches hitting it the sound quality is very good compared to some of the other cameras out there. I personally really like this gopro. I highly suggest this camera because it holds up to my expectations. It’s easy to adjust the settings like the quality of the camera and the fps (frames per second) with the gopro app that you can get on android phones and apples products. You can also watch the videos right then and there on your phone or Ipad. It may not be the cheapest option but its definitely worth your money.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Kye R.
Reviews.Content: easy to use, nothing wrong with it. i would get this if i was looking for a good camera for recreational reasons

Reviews.Title: Love it when it works
Reviews.Author: Mike Jones
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this action cam.  As soon as I got it, took it out and shot some night footage.  Without changing a single setting this cam took great low light video.  Mind you, it preforms much better with adequate light, but I am still impressed.The only problem is that a week after I received the hero 3+ Black Edition, the wifi radio died.  GoPro customer service has been great to deal with, but having to deal with them so soon is concerning.  I hope that this was a fluke, and that I just received a bad unit.  I purchased enough accessories that totaled almost enough to buy a second Hero 3+ Black Edition.  So, you can see why I'd be frustrated, not being able to use them.Even with that situation, I still rate this item at a 4 because of it's capabilities.  When working, this camera is amazing.  As soon as I get my replacement, I'm sure it will be taking up most of my free time again.  I will update if I have any further issues.

Reviews.Title: A lot of power in a small package
Reviews.Author: Chris Donat
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to attach on to my DJI Phantom 2 quadcopter.  I read the reviews, and watched the YouTube videos of what others had done, but that was nothing compared to what the actual camera had in store.This camera is simply one of the most amazing piece of electronics I have ever used.  I set the video for 1080P and 48 fps and began to admire the skyline of Tucson, AZ even more than I already did.The user interface is a bit quirky, but elegant as there are only 2 buttons to interface with.  One thing that I dont understand, and I find annoying is the fact that I can not delete videos from the folder screen on my PC.  You actually have to delete them using the camera menu interface.The fish-eyed lens effect kind of stinks when looking straight down on a landscape, but GoPro's software looks to have a means of fixing that, but I havent used it yet.

Reviews.Title: Life changing
Reviews.Author: Raúl Dutra
Reviews.Content: Life changing because I passed from filming "some" s*** with my cel in a normal-bad quality, to having everything recorded in full hd with the GOPRO. The superview wide view is worth buying the black edition and not the other ones. As well, the app for cellphones and the studio for PC work perfectly (I have a s***ty cellphone - samsung galaxy ace plus - android).GoPro ROCKS.

Reviews.Title: husband loves to use while surfing
Reviews.Author: krisshoppernyc
Reviews.Content: my husband thought this was the best birthday present ever.  uses it while surfing and paddle boarding.  i find the videos a bit boring but  he's having a good time so who cares!  really amazing technology, water slides right off the camera so there aren't any water spots on the lens, i think that is super cool.

Reviews.Title: GoPro Hero3: White Edition (New Housing)
Reviews.Author: scienceteacher62
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the GoPro Hero3: White Edition (New Housing) to anyone wanting to record anything they are seeing while performing an adventurous task.  Once it is set-up properly the pictures are clear and concise.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for in-car vids at the track.
Reviews.Author: Alan J. Wolfe
Reviews.Content: Takes great video and sound.  I love the wifi and the android app.  Much better than fiddling with the camera menu.

Reviews.Title: NOT JUST AN ACTION CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Esteban
Reviews.Content: SO MUCH TO SAY ABOUT THIS CAMERA.Im going to start with the only CON i can think of, and that is that I feel the quality on this camera is not as good as the regular hero 3 [not plus] when it comes to pictures.Everything else is amazing.The clarity of pictures is still great, the video is equivalent to many more expensive cameras. Its small, lightweight, and fast. There are tons of uses for this camera.I feel I should give some advice on it, because you probably already know that its a great camera.If you are using it for something other than skydiving or bungee jumping [basically anything that doesn't take 5 minutes], buy extra batteries. I have used mine at the zoo, birthday parties, family football games, road trips. The battery is roughly 2 hours 10 minutes recording at 1080.If you have wifi turned on battery times drops down significantly. ONLY TURN ON WIFI WHEN USING IT, turn it off once you stop using it.One big tip that people complain about is that you can't get a long time lapse. You CAN do an overnight time lapse with this camera if you have it plugged in, however, you must first turn the camera on, and then connect it to the charger. I don't know why, but if you plug it in and then try to charge it, it won't work.One great thing they got rid of from the hero 3 no plus, is that you don't have to connect it to your computer in order to use the mobile app. If you are using this for anything that is not water based [anything where you are willing to take out your phone] do NOT pay for the lcd backpac, and just download the go pro app. Turn on your cameras wifi, go to your phones wifi settings and use that to see what you are recording, AND what you have already recorded. Certain record settings will not allow this [superview, 1440, 2.7K, 4K]Not only will you be able to see what you are doing and have done, but you can use your phone as a remote that is much faster than the remote it comes with.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding first time accident and the camera survived.
Reviews.Author: Chandler "J. O."
Reviews.Content: So, I have a video taken the first time the camera was used in action. I bought the extra wrist strap (which I will write a separate review for) and it broke, the first time, in the first seconds we used it. The Camera came off of my friends wrist, it sank to the bottom of the ocean over 40 feet down, it surfed back and forth on the sea floor all night long. It filmed until the low battery warning when it shut off. The next morning a spear fisherman found it, tried to work it and accidently got a few pics of him self. Once I got the camera back, it was dry, working and ready to go with a battery change and charge. The lens on the case is not scratched and the camera works great still. I do recommend you get a floater strap for it to avoid my circumstance. I am lucky I got it back. If Ifigure out how to load the video by amazons silly standards I will.

Reviews.Title: A vast improvement from the Hero3 Black. Its everything GoPro promised.
Reviews.Author: L. Copps
Reviews.Content: Last year I purchased a Hero3 Black and had nothing but problems with lockups, corrupted cards, and it ate my batteries like candy. So I returned it and waited for a redesign.  GoPro promised the Hero3+ Black was 30 percent sharper, longer battery life, and runs better.  After using it on my Sea Kayak and skiing, I can say they finally got it right and perfectly delivered on their promises.  Apparently, early adopters of the Hero3+ black have experienced problems with focus on objects greater than 4 feet away, but in my January 2014 camera, I can say this problem is no longer there, and it is stunningly sharp on objects near and far.  The mountains in the background of my shots show amazing detail.  On clear day clips, my friends were simply blown away by the sharpness and vivid rich colors.  GoPro could stand to make the white balance a little aggressive in flat light situations.  Last week I skied with my Hero3+ black in Utah and had the camera on most of the day, each day, with Wifi turned on.  I changed the battery at lunch and the camera would work pretty much the whole day with recording around 20-30 min of video at 1080p 60fps per day.  I still have 32 and 64 GB SanDisk ultra cards from my original Hero3 that did not seem to work well with the original Hero3, but work great in the Hero3+.  However, I would buy the Extreme or the Lexar 600x cards as GoPro recommends.  Preferably the Lexar given SanDisk's checkered past with GoPro.  The smaller case of the the Hero3+ feels like less camera strapped to your head.  During the day, I use 2 Wasabi 1200 mah batteries that come with an external charger to power it which seem to last all day.  I do not use the USB cable on the camera at all.  On my trip, the camera never locked up and worked well, responding much faster than my Hero3 ever did when it worked.  The remote is a must if you really want to use this camera effectively.  In a sea kayak you cannot reach the camera, and skiing, the camera is nearly impossible to operate properly with gloves on.  I always strap the remote to my wrist with a velcro wrist strap, available very cheap on Amazon and worth the small expense.  The GoPro App has been improved and lets you preview your shot with your smartphone and easily adjust all the camera settings.  However, the video lag is about 3-4 seconds in the preview, but it works adequately for aiming the camera.  The GoPro app also lets you replay your recordings on your phone with no noticeable time lag. I normally do not use the app since my environment is too hostile for a smartphone or my iPod Touch.  The remote is more than adequate for my times out.  The remote can also change all the settings, but cannot be used to preview or review recordings.  I use my kayaking videos to examine my kayak rolling and paddle techniques in the pool or in the Atlantic surf.  If you are an action junkie like me, this is the only camera to get.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Raul Flamini "RFG"
Reviews.Content: The only thing that i would suggest is finding a way to make the batteries last a little longer, but overall this camera gives you options no other camera does.

Reviews.Title: This is a GREAT camera!  The clarity is amazing even at long distances.  I read other reviews re: the clarity far away it great!
Reviews.Author: Holly Jacobs
Reviews.Content: The clarity is amazing even at long distances.  I read other reviews regarding the clarity from far away, it is amazing.  My son wakeboards and you can see everything crystal clear, including the trees on the opposite shore, more than 10 feet away!  This is a great camera and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome customer service
Reviews.Author: Deborah L. Jenders
Reviews.Content: Bought a Hero 3+ silver. On the first day I used it, water got into the plastic housing and damaged the camera. Suspect the cause was using the anti fog inserts. Note that I learned that the inserts are for older models and fit too tightly on the sides of the camera. This was never mentioned to me nor stated on the GOPRO package. Likely the back cover didn't close tightly and thus water seeped in. Not sure if this was user error or not. I guess it could be. Explained the situation to Shawn in GOPRO customer support. He realized that I was on vacation and personally contacted the dealer that I purchased the unit from to have them exchange my damaged unit for a new one. Absolutely fantastic customer support. By the way, I love the camera. Great video.

Reviews.Title: Great camera although battery life could be better
Reviews.Author: Armando Piedra
Reviews.Content: I love my GoPro and the only issues I can state are:- The fisheye effect when the camera is somewhat close to the face (e.g. when my kids use it, they have short arms and point it to themselves)- the battery life...hmmm, I really could use a little more battery life but if you dont connect to the iPhone too much it usually lasts you as long as your SD Card will- Wish there were a way to charge the battery wihtout taking the camera out (ideally using wirelss chargers like on the Wii Remotes, etc)Otherwise a great buy and I would do it again any time.

Reviews.Title: Definitely an improvement
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Has its problems like the clarity of the new lens when filming things farther away, but it is definitely the best helmet camera out there Battery life is good. Only problem ive had is dirt getting stuck around the lens and it scratches very easily.

Reviews.Title: Good at what it does.
Reviews.Author: Team Nix
Reviews.Content: I could write a book on my experiences with this camera but I'll try to keep it informative for potential purchasers.The camera works well for videos and still shots and the free software (GoPro Studio 2) is not difficult to learn but does take some time to be familiar with it.Be careful about purchasing a memory card. It must meet the specs on the GoPro website. It also must work (I purchased a 64gb card from Amazon with good reviews but was losing videos and still shots when the card was over 1/3 full. The card was tested with a free program called h2testw which showed bad sectors. I've had it too long to return it, so I'll purchase another one locally,  and I'll definitely test it before use).GoPro Studio 2 works well with shots taken with their camera, but not with a Cannon Powershot I also own. I end up exporting in Archive mode, then import into Windows Movie Maker to assemble my videos with the Powershot images included.To make the videos or stills "pop" increase the saturation to about 1.4  This makes colors brighter. To create black and white decrease the saturation to 0  To steal a still shot from a video, pause at the shot you want, make whatever changes you want such as saturation or zoom, then click "file" in the left upper corner, click "export", then click "still". It will ask you for a name and file time and then you're done. As a cyclist I use this so I can take a video over my head of a group of riders behind me. By moving the camera around, I'm likely to get a number of shots showing what I want to see.If you want to speed up or slow down a portion of a video, you can cut it into sections assigning different speeds to each section. You can also take a still at a cut and use it to install a pause in the action. Lots of fun stuff but time consuming.Don't think you can buy this camera for $400. You need a card, then of course you'll need mounts, maybe an LCD monitor for the back when you want to take stills, remote, extra batteries, etc.The GoPro website has a lot of help with great ideas and I cut & pasted a lot of text to make my own help file.Hope this review helps. I'm not sorry I bought it, but I still use the Powershot to take stills as it's just easier.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: VE126153 Edinson
Reviews.Content: Must take into account that no zoom and it does not come with memory card. Without a MicroSD not working. But it's great.

Reviews.Title: Gopro is great
Reviews.Author: Logan Jones
Reviews.Content: This camera is rugged and very simple to use. With wifi capabilities, using the gopro app on your apple or android device is very convenient, easy, and free.  Great camera for whatever you do.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael Royzen
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely amazing!  I use it for capturing HD skiing videos and for all sorts of other sport footage!  I completely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT! BUY IT!
Reviews.Author: Luis Alvarado "Mary"
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect, is small, powerfull, waterproof, the lens is very wide and the focus is beutifull. Wi-Fi works very nice and the conection to the "GoProApp" is amazing. The case is really hard, so you dont have to worry about the safety of the camera. Works perfect for helmets :D ......The only thing a dont like was that the MicroSD did not came in the box, i was i little disapointed but its ok, you just have to buy one for 30$ is not big deal.BUY IT! DONT THINK IT TWICE!!(SORRY FOR BAD ENGLISH)

Reviews.Title: My second one already
Reviews.Author: Harith Al-Kubaisy
Reviews.Content: This is my second GoPro 3+ already in a short time, my first one drowning in one of the most amazing sinkholes of this planet after performing a cliff jump.Cliff jumping with a headstrap, not a good idea.

Reviews.Title: Has it all
Reviews.Author: BruceBetter
Reviews.Content: I got this for my son for Xmas, as he is in Spec Ops and is always doing the most extreme things as part of his everyday job. This little baby comes with it all, only thing needed is the special attachment to where your going to wear it or attach it.

Reviews.Title: The Best sports/hobby camera hands down!
Reviews.Author: Sterling L. Robertson
Reviews.Content: There are so many uses for the GoPro line its rediculous. This camera is small, light, and does everything well. The battery life has improved so that you can record the highest setting with wifi on for about 90 mins. It goes up a bit from there but not too much longer. I would say two hours recording on most setting is the max you can get out of one battery. I highly recommend the Wasabi batteries and charger but the stock GoPro battery won't fit in the Wasabi charger, just a heads up. It is tough to keep the wifi remoto charged all the time as you can not change its battery and its easy to not know that it is on and run down its battery when not in use. For updates to the camera you have to copy firmware files to the microSD card then power on the camera with the card inserted and the updates will take effect. The older models used the GoPro Cinema 2.0 to do updates but not the Hero 3+. I also highly recommend the FRAME for this camera if not flying over water or in winds over 100mph as it is much lighter, great for flying deviced like the DJI F450, F550, S800 and Phantom for killer aerial video footage. This is what I use to film motorcycles and places I just can't reach by holding a camera. Check out my youtube at youtube.com/slrkappa for some videos I have shot with this GoPro Hero 3+ Black! I still have two of the Hero 2's and one orginal SD GoPro Hero camera and the 3+ Black is many times better, lighter and smaller by far! You can use this camera to film time lapse videos as I have done, underwater shots, slow motion HD video in 720 @120 frames per second and WVGA @ 240 FRAMES PER SECOND! How amazing is that for slow motion that fits in the palm of your hand? Make sure to get the Class 10 micro SD as well as the 64GB size if you can afford it. The smaller the card the more time you will spend copying all your videos back and forth to your computer. I can even fill up a 64gb card in no time as it will hold just over 4 hours of 1080P in superview.

Reviews.Title: The everyday use review
Reviews.Author: Dave "Dave"
Reviews.Content: Its a 5-star, 10 out of 10.... Its amazing.  I am not going to bore you with the nuts and bolts review, there are plenty of those here on amazon and on the web.  I can going to comment on my practical every day use.It easy enough to turn on, shoot amazingly clear and vivid video. The Hero3+ has great 12mp stills and my favorite feature is the time lapse (interval meter mode). A lot of people I know get this camera after I recommend it and then say they don't know what to use it for or how/when...  I just tell them to take it out and start recording, you can always delete.  Watch some Youtube videos and experiment.  Buy some extra batteries and go!I always have Hero Plus on me.  If the sunset is amazing, I will take some stills or set it up with the Jaws Clap mount and take a time lapse of the sunset or weather clouds rolling by for a quick dynamic video.  I also mount it in my car as a dash cam, maybe getting a video of something crazy that might happen.  We pull it out to take 30 pics/1 second stills in 30/1-mode at the baseball field if someone is hitting to see the progress of the hitters swing.  I also mount it on my surfboard with the surf mount and a floaty or hold the camera in my mouth biting the floaty as I take off on the wave for a great perspective.  I have mounted the camera to my helmet for snowboarding, mountain biking and paintball as well as drilling hole through the bill of my hat for wakeboarding and wake-skating.The remote is waterproof and works great.  The phone app is also awesome, just be aware of the fact that there is a little more battery drain.  If I am using the wifi mode (for remote or app) then I put on the Battery BacPac to add double the battery life.I have upgraded from HeroHD (1) all the way to Hero3+.  The versatility of this camera pays for itself along with the video/still quality and how many settings you can change.  If you are only going to buy one GoPro, get the Hero3+ Black Edition.  If you going to have more, its till work it to have the Hero3+ Black, but you can save some $$ going Hero3+ Silver.Be sure to buy a 64 gb SDHX Class 10 card, I use SanDisc, I wait till amazon has it on sale for under $50, it will at least once a month.Have fun and use it, you can always delete it!

Reviews.Title: Great improvments
Reviews.Author: Sean Reynolds
Reviews.Content: I still wish GoPro  would offer the option to shoot RAW photos. I thought the video was exceptional at 1080p. I used it with my quadcoppter and was impressed with the results. I have read the other complaints about focal length, but I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: works awesome!
Reviews.Author: Nicole J. Richardson
Reviews.Content: the husband wanted something he could use for his blog while flying his plane or riding his motorcycle. works awesome...and now i have to watch a million and one amateur videos of my guy trying not to kill himself on all of his toys lol. thanks gopro

Reviews.Title: THE BEST CAMERA IN THE WORLD
Reviews.Author: aj
Reviews.Content: Awesome... The best camera in the world for xtreme sports and you can used for other porpouses. dhdhdh dhdhdhd dhdh

Reviews.Title: Great action photos! Lots of fun!
Reviews.Author: MacInTX
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for catching all the action up close and personal. With the protective case you can safely put this camera close to the action. The built in Wifi makes it a snap to check placement of the camera. I wish that it had a display for those times when you wanted to take a quick snapshot.
