But that would probably reduce its ruggedness. You can easily work around this by using the burst mode and then choosing the best photo(s) from the captured set.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressive
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: This takes excellent pictures in and out of the water. (Snorkeling) The quality is better than a lot of  normal cameras. This was a gift and a real hit for a 36 year old. They also took pictures diving into a pool. You can see mutiple shots per second. As a result when diving in a pool you see bubbles going through the fingers, up the body, and through the toes. It is like watching someone in a wind tunnel. I am totally impressed with this camera above and under the water.

Reviews.Title: Super awesome
Reviews.Author: Walker Clan "CAW"
Reviews.Content: I am not sure I can love this camera more, ultra lightweight, super durable, awesome videos, and wifi into my smartphone....wow!

Reviews.Title: If it's good enough for a pro, it's good enough for me!
Reviews.Author: Doug1
Reviews.Content: I knew what I was getting into when I purchased this camera.  A fellow diver friend is a professional news videographer and his video camera of choice when he dives is the GoPro.  He also has persuaded the TV station he works with to purchase some of these and they use these when they want to add action shots from a perspective that you could not get from a standard professional camera.  I've seen his resulting videos and they look great.I wish there was a 4.5 star rating to give this camera.  There are some items that should have been included from the beginning with this camera.For one the door that gives you access to the battery compartment and the door that gives you access to the hdmi and usb connections should be tethered to the camera some sort of way.  They are tiny (as they should be for a tiny camera)  and can easily be lost.Additionally, I have never seen a quality camera that did not come with some sort of lens cap or other mechanism to protect the lens when the camera is not in use.  The actually camera, when out of the housing has a protruding, convex front element (which allows for super wide angle shots) that could easily be fingerprinted or damaged while handling the camera to change batteries, changing memory cards, attaching cables, etc.  These cameras are so often used in active outdoor activities involving salt water and snow and I feel like the caps could benefit to keep crud off the lens while out of the housing.But, no worries, GoPro will sell you a package for about $19  that includes camera lens cap, a protective lens, extra doors and a cover that protects the lens port on the housing and simultaneously covers the power button to prevent accidentally turning the camera on.

Reviews.Title: Issue with mounts/buckles when upgrading
Reviews.Author: T Dragon
Reviews.Content: So far the camera works great but I found one issue if you are upgrading from an older GoPro.GoPro seem to have changed the specs for the mounts/buckles from the original GoPro Hero.My helmet already had mounts stuck to them from my GoPro Hero but the buckles from the Hero 3+ don't fit properly in these mounts, they are extremely tight and don't lock all the way in. Its impossible to remove the adhesive mounts from helmets once stuck so I cant easily replace with new mounts.My solution was to use the buckles from my old GoPro with the new camera. In the future if I purchase new adhesive mounts for other applications I will need to be aware of which buckles to use.Why did GoPro do this don't they know people upgrade?

Reviews.Title: The ONLY action cam to own
Reviews.Author: Element04
Reviews.Content: This is the best cam on the market.I have owned several action cams for use with watersports and with snow sports as well. The camera is amazingly light weight but feels very well made and protected in the casing. The remote is amazing, I don't have to reach for the record button on the front of my PWC, i can just use the button i have strapped to my wrist.Hands down the best, no competition.

Reviews.Title: Loved so much, I bouth two
Reviews.Author: D. ENRIQUE Puig "Dan-o"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, crisp clear 1080p video, both under water and on cloudy days.Purchased two for recording two angles of the same event

Reviews.Title: Have to Have
Reviews.Author: auctionguy
Reviews.Content: For anyone doing anything from family outings to ziplining to my business uses this small camera does it all....just get one you wont be sorry

Reviews.Title: Sweet little camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Amos
Reviews.Content: Having fun with this camera, it's so versatile.So far I've mounted it in my jeep and on my bicycle and it's worked like a champ.One oddity I noticed when viewing the video after transferring it off the camera via the iPhone app. Because I mounted the camera upside down I set the settings to compensate, which they did bit then the video was mirrored in the horizontal axis.... Very odd. I'm not sure if it's user error or a bug in the software/app yet.The wireless control with the app is my favorite function, but beware of wifi interference.

Reviews.Title: A gift that keeps on giving.
Reviews.Author: MauraJ "parthenon"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my grandson who mounts it on his helmet and takes video of his motor cross races.  It's a big hit with him.

Reviews.Title: Loves it!
Reviews.Author: N. Lasley
Reviews.Content: Gift for my son and he loves it. Has only used it skiing but has lots of other plans for it. Is very impressed with picture quality.

Reviews.Title: All around nice action camera.
Reviews.Author: Mark Freeman
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by this camera.  I have used it in a few different applications. I tried driving through a pretty curvy road. That was really cool. I used it to record what it was like to have a brew day, and my friend used it to go caving. It easily attaches to a helmet or your dash. My only complaints would be the sound isn't great. Maybe it was a software configuration to turn the mike up, but I didn't seem to get very loud sound. Also, the video was kind of fish-eye.  Cool when driving, but not as cool when you want to get a close up of something with a really clean shot. These are probably both settings, but be aware that if I couldn't easily figure it out, it may take some time to learn.Overall, I think it is a nice all around action camera. The protective screen is a must if you plan on using it near dirt or the water. It is definitely a high quality product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for 'selfies' footage, limited for filmmaking
Reviews.Author: B. Rose
Reviews.Content: The HERO3+ series of GoPro cameras allegedly represent a step up from the HERO3 series in terms of battery life and wireless data transfer, as well as 'sharper' focus.The HERO3+ is a solid step up if you have a HERO or HERO2 camera, but probably not a major improvement for you if you're already working with a HERO3 (I recently reviewed a HERO3 Black edition camera and was blown away by its performance -- I experienced none of the firmware-related issues that are so common in the product reviews).A lot of people are complaining about the reconfiguration of the HERO3+ to a new, 'sharper' lens... perhaps it is indeed sharper at close range (selfie-shots from the nose of a surfboard, for instance), but many are saying it loses focus around the edges & at distances greater than a few meters. I've not noticed an appreciable improvement in 'sharpness' in my use -- I mount it at the nose of my shortboard, just like me HERO3 Black Edition, and film at 720p / 60fps... since my TV is 720p, anything higher would just be a waste of storage capacity on my card. I can't tell a difference in footage; both are crystal clear, like I'm watching a professional film. The people/waves in the background are too small to worry about anyway due to the wide angle of the HERO3 / HERO3+ lenses, so I think this problem only manifests if you're trying to use the HERO3+ to film landscapes or other people at distances of 4-10 meters (past that they'll be tiny anyway).I managed to burn through my battery in about 3.5 hours of on-off (mostly on) surfing footage and about 120 clips (most of them short, ~10 seconds). At the lowest settings, an hour of footage eats up about 8GB of storage space. Battery life might be somewhat improved over the HERO3 (WiFi turned OFF) but I managed to avoid the battery life issue altogether by snagging a couple extra batteries and a wall charger for about thirty bucks.The WiFi improvement doesn't concern me, as I don't use WiFi with my GoPro cameras... I strap them on my board and activate them manually, and do data transfer via the included mini-USB cable.I'm giving this camera 4 stars because the focus issue would seem to limit the applications for this camera to strictly "selfie" shots. This is a pretty major limiter when you're talking about a sports camera. Seeing as the HERO3 Silver Edition is ten percent cheaper and doesn't have this issue, you might be better off going with that one (or even the White edition) or just waiting for this issue to be addressed in the next generation of HERO cameras.

Reviews.Title: Awesome -- best birthday gift I've had.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it!  Still exploring different video modes, finding the 1080p looks astounding after finding a player that can handle it.  It handles a 64 GB SD card with no problem.  Downside -- controls are perfect for a right-hander like me, but awkward for a motorcyclist who wants to keep the right hand on the throttle/brake.  Many videos end with the fingers of my left hand sweeping across the field of view.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Richard Nicholson
Reviews.Content: I am using the camera for an Remote Control helicopter application. The performance is better than expected. It is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Better than I could have imagined!
Reviews.Author: Morley Dotes "morleydotes"
Reviews.Content: I never would would have thought this camera would have been this good. I used it riding our skateboard ramp and also riding our bikes. First I used it, the mistake was letting my son try it....he now wants to use it for everything! The unit is very small and you really don't think about it. It is waterproof to 131 feet, so we can't wait for summer to try it while surfing and snorkeling! Out of the water, the images were sharp and clean, even in lower light, there wasn't much noise at all. I had no issues with blurred images, and was actually a little worried when I read some of the other reviews.Battery life is great with wifi off. The the phone app for my Galaxy is great. It is really crucial so that you can aim the camera properly. I have not had any real issues with it. Keep in mind I have never used a GoPro before, and this is my first experience. That being said, if you do anything out doors, this is a MUST have! Even it this price, which seems high but really isn't....especially considering how it will enhance your experience, regardless of activity. I would also say that it will make you more active, because you will want to use this more often. This is one of those products that's am in love with, and I don't give out five stars easily, especially because it is one of those things that I didn't think much of. I am so glad I got this!

Reviews.Title: Due to improvements in lighter weight and better video, a fantastic action camera
Reviews.Author: Citizen John
Reviews.Content: To compare this action camera with perhaps the best-selling action camera, Liquid Image XSC 338WApex, I've compared some of the specs below.  An apple-to-apple comparison isn't possible because the two cameras are used a bit differently with the Liquid Image top-selling camera fixed onto goggles whereas the GoPro silver has a lot of flexibility in use.  The current pricing of both products is very similar.WeightGoPro HERO3+ Silver - 2.6 ozLiquid Image XSC 338WApex - 8.5 ozBattery Life (using more apps depletes battery charge faster)GoPro HERO3+ Silver - 90min - 165minLiquid Image XSC 338WApex - 90min - 120minMax Image (still photo) ResolutionGoPro HERO3+ Silver - 3680 x 2760Liquid Image XSC 338WApex - 2592 x 1944AudioGoPro HERO3+ Silver - Mono, 48kHz, AAC compression with AGC (automatic gain control)Liquid Image XSC 338WApex - Mono, unpublishedMemoryGoPro HERO3+ Silver - MicroSD cardLiquid Image XSC 338WApex - MicroSD cardMaximum StorageGoPro HERO3+ Silver - 64GBLiquid Image XSC 338WApex - 32GBSystem RequirementsGoPro HERO3+ Silver - Mac OS® X 10.5 and later / Microsoft Windows® Vista, 7 and laterLiquid Image XSC 338WApex - Windows XP/,Vista, Windows7, and MAC 10.4 or aboveWi-FiGoPro HERO3+ Silver - yesLiquid Image XSC 338WApex - noThe two action cameras are meant for different uses yet they are in the same price range and Liquid Image is a top-seller.  I think the GoPro HERO3+ Silver is clearly a much better camera and with better audio and applications such as Wi-Fi.  This GoPro camera can be used in a lot of situations such as with biking, driving or on any vehicle that moves including helicopters.  This is an excellent camera based on the video I captured while driving.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected, great functionality
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M. Morse
Reviews.Content: I have a buddy who has an older Hero2 and the latest Hero3+ Black Edition.  After talking to him and looking at a bunch of his videos from each, I decided on the Hero3 White Edition based on what features I wanted.  To me there was no question about the quality or reliability, these things are great for years.  I wanted the ability to get HD 1080p vids at 30fps, but didn't have a reason to get the 60fps or the higher-res formats available in the Hero3+ Black.  Those really are great features if you need them, the video quality is amazing, but wasn't necessary for me personally.  One thing I learned about the White edition that i got is it has the ability to link to my iPhone (and other phones I'm sure but check the specs) and review videos or watch a live feed from the camera with only a few second delay, via a wifi connection using the GoPro app. I can also use the phone as a remote control for starting and stopping recording too, which for me makes having a separate remote unnecessary.  Mine came with both the watertight enclosure and the skeleton back if you want clearer sound and don't need the protection.  I wish GoPro included a little bit of memory with the package, you can't record without it. Separately I bought a 32GB Ultra Micro SDHC card, gives me more recording capacity than I need, many hours.

Reviews.Title: Very poor battery life
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Price
Reviews.Content: I  bought my GoPro in January this year.  So far the best battery time I've gotten has been 1 hour 26 min.  However it keeps getting worse.  I did a test for the GoPro help desk and got 26 min.  I contacted GoPro , which you can only do by email and took three days to respond, and was told to reformat the SD card.  I did.  I got 26 minutes of record time.  I also had to send a picture of the inside of the battery box on the camera. I did.  The last email  I received from GoPro was yesterday.  They must not work on weekends, because I've received nothing back about the information I sent them.  I've used this camera once and it has failed to run anywhere near the time advertised by GoPro.

Reviews.Title: GoPro has many defective products. The Silver 3+ has issues with the earliest model
Reviews.Author: Ron McCoy
Reviews.Content: Bought one based on reviews. Should have checked the forum as there are many, many issues with the GoPro 3+ models being DOA. Unbelievable that a company would even still try to sell the items without a full recall. I will not be a GoPro customer as I'll return this and look to a reputable company like Sony. How disappointing.UPDATE 1/22/14It seems the GoPro 3+ is packaged with two different model cameras, one older and one newer along with newer software installed. The camera I originally bought said GoPro 3+ on the box and came with a note stating it needed to be updated prior to use. On the body of the camera itself, it stated only GoPro 3.  Since the camera was DOA I was never able to update it.  I stand by my review for that item.  However, I did exchange the unit for a model which is paged as a GoPro3+ and also states it on the camera body itself.  Does it appear GoPro was just trying to sell the GoPro 3 as a 3+ once you updated it?  I'm not sure but I can see the lens is different on the newer model and the feel seems somewhat more solid. The waterproof case is also a better locking design.  So far the newer, exchanged model is working just fine. Actually, really good. Integrated with my iPhone GoPro App well and the images look good. Still testing but wanted to at least share a variable.

Reviews.Title: Dead simple operation and great picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Richard Aubin
Reviews.Content: This is my first GoPro and I have not had the opportunity to compare it to previous iterations.  Simplicity is king (once you figure out how to unpack the thing and open the case) and that makes sense for a camera destined for use in recording from the action  POV.  I had an early version of a Samsung digital recorder with a bullet cam and the operation was too complex in most circumstances to effectively use it.  Picture quality simply blows me away, but I don't have the comparator of previous models.The picture quality and dead simple operation of the GoPro makes it easy to use in an active situation and has me longing to retrace some rides in the Black Hills.If you are buying this as a gift, make sure to order a Micro SD Card with a Class 10 rating or better as it doesn't even come with a small capacity card.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly versitle
Reviews.Author: Don Walton Jr.
Reviews.Content: Physically, there isn't much to a GoPro HERO3+.  No viewfinder, simple menu system, three buttons (power, wifi power and the typical 'snap a photo' button), no digital display, no flash.  Take it out of the waterproof case, and all you have is a tiny little camera that looks a bit like a toy.  They stripped it down to the bare minimum, but what the GoPro can do will blow your mind.  Or blow my mind anyway.By creating it's own local wi-fi network, you actually use your phone, or iPod as a viewfinder.  There is a little lag between what you're actually taping, and the display, but its a pretty neat revelation the first time you use it.  Very easy to connect and set up.  I'm no professional filmmaker or photographer, but I had it set up in less than 5 minutes.  Then I passed my phone or camera around a group of friends and everyone started cracking up, having fun watching and fun shooting.It comes with this weird bracket/screw thing on the bottom of the waterproof case.  I thought 'Well, this sucks.  You have unscrew all this junk to swap out mounts?'  I was wrong.  Yes, you unscrew this little knob to change mounts (there are many available - everything from headstraps to suction cups), but its only threaded in about 3 threads or so.  Only takes 4 turns to take the mount off ie. two seconds.  Very nice, simple, straightforward design.I bought a headstrap for the GoPro so I could film my twin babies at home.  Its hard to juggle them as it is, nevertheless trying to snap photos of video of them.  I stuck the camera on my head, and then took a video feeding both of them.  Probably not the intended use, most GoPro ads show them strapped to snowboards or BMX bikes, but it was a nice way to capture a memory of the babies before they grow up.My only big knock is that you MUST have a microSD card (not included) for the camera to use it at all.  So, I got the camera, then had to order a memory card.  They're cheap enough, but it would have been nice to include a small 4gb card to get your feet wet until you find something bigger to use.  There is an HDMI port and a USB adapter to hook it up to your computer or TV.Overall, what a cool gadget!  Just walking around my daily life, I thought of a million little events that would be fun to capture with the GoPro - everything from waking the babies up, to playing pinball, running around the yard, touring a pinball playfield in 'first person' mode, etc.  A must have gadget for the tech savvy.

} } } Length:: 0:46 MinsI jumped at the chance to try this camera via the Vine Program, to use for snow sports (skiing, snowmobiling). Since it's not the season yet, I am testing it as a dash cam. I initially mounted the first flat adhesive mount onto my dashboard, directly in front of the steering wheel. Considering this camera is a wide screen, it just didn't work as planned. After a few days, I used a hair dryer, I heated the mount, and after a few minutes, it easily removed from the dashboard without leaving any marks, stains, or residues. I mounted another just in front of my cd drive, which is centered and at the top of the dashboard (2014 Ford Escape), and it does not interfere with putting in or removing a cd. Much better; I now get almost the entire windshield view, but unfortunately, part of the dashboard as well. Tilting the camera upright helps a bit, but makes for an odd video. I tried to eliminate that by purchasing the GoPro Helmet Front Mount, but the video was extremely shaky & noisy, moreso than with using the standard mount that came with the camera.The menu is kind of confusing for a newbie, but after time, it's easy enough to figure out. The still shots I did manage to take while driving, were pretty clear and nothing seemed out of focus. But although I pressed the button quite a bit, it only managed to take a few shots, much less than I thought I took. At one point, I kept pressing the button, only to have one jpg show up on the card. The housing itself it kind of hard to open; I managed to break a few nails, but with time, I got the hang of it, even managing to snap it off, but eventually got it back on. The seal seems tight, after about 20 openings/closings of the case. I tested it the hot tub, and it was indeed watertight. The daylight video itself was surprisingly grainy, something definitely not expected.Right off the bat, I installed at 16gb SD card, but that quickly filled up, after what seemed to be only a small amount of time. So I purchased SanDisk Ultra 32 GB MicroSDHC C10/UHS1 Memory Card with Adapter (SDSDQU-032G-AFFP-A), and haven't had it fill up, but then again, I'm pretty good about offloading & freeing up space. A long trip would require multiple cards for sure.I also purchased Wasabi Power Battery (2-Pack) and Charger for GoPro HD HERO3, HERO3+ and GoPro AHDBT-201, AHDBT-301, AHDBT-302, since the battery definitely needs recharging after a few hours. The original battery that came with the camera didn't initially fit, but after some shoving, it fit & charged. The replacement battery fits inside the camera perfectly.The one major issue I have is that I wish it had a LCD viewer on the back of the camera. Whether using it as a dash cam or snorkeling, I'd like to see that I'm at least pointing it in the right direction, and not too high or too low or at an off centered angle.It takes a nice video and the coloring is beautiful, but I look forward to testing it out on the slopes. I'm not sure what type of mount I will go with, most likely a chest harness, since I don't wear a helmet.EDIT: Another small thing that bothers me is why it doesn't have a tripod mount built directly into the bottom of the camera? Yes, I know there's an additional mount (GoPro Tripod Mount) that can be purchased that can be used when using the case, but what if you just want to use the standalone camera without the case? It certainly couldn't have hurt to put one on the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: Has some cool new features, and some dumb new features.
Reviews.Author: Hunter Byron
Reviews.Content: The Hero3+ has a sleeker look than the more rugged looking Hero3. Both are great cameras, but as stated in other reviews there are some drawbacks. I recently did a shoot where both the Hero3 and Hero3+ were used. The coloring of the 3+ seemed much better and easier to work with when matching it with the DSLRS also used in the shoot. The Hero3+ has a noticeably longer battery life and was mounted to the handlebars of a Harley, while the Hero3 was mounted on a DJI Phantom. Both cameras performed quite well, the Hero3 got some amazing aerial footage of the mountains the ride was on. While the Hero3+ provided extremely smooth footage and really brought out the detail in the road and closeup scenery. Luckily the ride was full of switchbacks so there weren't many areas for the Hero3+ to look soft and out of focus. The wifi ability is a big improvement over the Hero3 and is definitely appreciated. My biggest complaint about the Hero3+ is that the case is junk compared to the Hero3. Mine came with a gash in the white rubber gasket and the latch broke off the third time using it. I wouldn't say I would want one over the other, but the Hero3+ was somewhat disappointing. Hopefully the Hero4 will live up to the hype.

Reviews.Title: Solid but not great
Reviews.Author: Jakester
Reviews.Content: This camera works ok but I don't have any experience with other action cameras so bear that in mind when reading this review.Pros:- Creates good still pictures. Quality is on a par with a smartphone.- Very solid casing and mounting hardware. The clear plastic casing and mounting hardware held the camera in place very well (I tested while bike riding).- Easy to get pictures off of camera onto PC. Uses a standard USB plug (included) and I just did a drag and drop using Windows 7.- Battery looks like it will hold a charge for quite a while.Cons:- Hard to unpack. Follow the directions carefully or you could end up breaking something when separating the camera from the packing.- Camera requires a Micro SD card to work. I have no problem with this but feel the card should have been included. With the cost of memory these days you shouldn't have to purchase additional items to get the camera to work out of the box.- Pictures taken while in motion tend to the blurry side.On the whole this is an ok camera and from what I've seen a good value when compared to competitors.

Reviews.Title: A great camera!
Reviews.Author: SonicOrbStudios "SonicOrbStudios"
Reviews.Content: I can't really say much in comparison to previous models as this is my first gopro camera.  I purchased this to mount on a quadcopter I have and I am really amazed.  The wide and normal settings are just too distorted for my liking but the narrow setting works just fine and hardly distorts.  the 1080p 60fps is fantastic and allows for some smooth style videos.  The unit is easy to use and the cable included lets you charge or plug into the computer for file transfer.  I suggest getting class 10 or higher cards.  if shooting 60fps, get a 64GB card which will be enough for a run of the battery.  Note that I was able to kill the battery in about an hour and a half so you may need a second or third of those, but they're quite cheap.Overall, some great videos and I highly suggest this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent addition to any camera arsenal.
Reviews.Author: eric talerico "Greenmanwest"
Reviews.Content: The GoPro Hero 3+ camera is a nifty little device.  It fits easily in the palm of your hand, or in a pocket, but don't let the size fool you. This camera is big on the inside!  Its simple point and shoot function is improved by an excellent wireless app for mobile devices that expands on its function making editing and transfer of images simple and flawless.The extreme wide angle lens captures anything in front of it - the inherent distortion of the lens can be countered by using the excellent lens profiles available for Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom -The Hero 3+ Silver edition includes a tough housing, waterproof and durable, which allows for a myriad of mounting options, from head and chest straps to tripod heads and adhesive mounts.I've been using mine for a week and although the hardware has worked flawlessly, I have had problems with my camera's wireless connection.  The problem was easily solved, but be aware that the mobile app is not 100% reliable.Otherwise, I am delighted with this item.Pros:WiFi iPad App allows 100% remote control.Extreme wide angle lens.Simple to set up and use.Good online support, well written and efficient user manual.Excellent photo and video quality.Excellent lens correction settings inPhotoshop and Lightroom.CompactWide variety of mounting optionsWaterproof to 131 meters inside included housing.Tough well built.Cons:No camera RAW option.No infinite focus as per other models.Device becomes very hot when running for a long time.Occasionally Wifi loses connection with iPad.

Reviews.Title: Previewing GoPro video feed without the gopro app
Reviews.Author: Jack Tailor "Jack Tailor"
Reviews.Content: This incremental step works as advertised. I tend to want to do more up-close photography / videography, so that seemed to work for me, but it does seem to be less ideal for far away things (maybe this a firmwear thing, maybe it's a lens thing)The low light setting seems too aggressive at times, but in ProTune, you can undo the overzealous corrections.If you were in the market for a GoPro, this is a good buy.One of my main gripes is that the GoPro app does not work on a laptop, only a phone or tablet. Laptops have Wifi too! This is a tremendous shortcoming!You can fake the live preview over wifi with apps in bluestacks (it's a hack, so don't expect this to work automatically), or you can use Video Lan Client ( a free download) and type in:http://10.5.5.9:8080/live/amba.m3u8In the open connection panel. You won't be able to access any of the live controls, but you will be able to see what your gopro sees (with a slight lag)

Reviews.Title: Great GoPro as usual, but not for KAP (kite aerial photography) ~ infinite focus
Reviews.Author: Kilgore Gagarin "Those who believe in telekin...
Reviews.Content: Not everyone is in to kite aerial photography (KAP) and if you're not, feel free to ignore this review. First, this GoPro camera is super light, does GREAT HD photography and video, and is solid as a bug. But if you're interested in hoisting this on a kite's line (me) it has a single fatal flaw. The inability to set for infinite focus is a deal breaker. It's not that this is bad or wrong, it has to do with the specs of this specific camera. For anything that doesn't require that your field of vision is out in the distance (i.e., suspended from a kite or balloon and shooting landscape far away) this is a typical GoPro stud camera in lightness, durability, etc.I use cheapo Canon SureShots for my KAP and they do a yeoman job. The GoPro Hero3+ Silver Edition does everything super awesome EXCEPT for the infinite focus I need for my kite photography. I would give this a full 5 out of 5 stars if this lack of feature were made clear, but a great camera for almost everything else I have to dock one star for what I need.Caveat: I've been reading the GoPro bulletin boards and I'm still not sure if this is something that can be cured by a firmware update (or a legal hack). If that happens, I'll update accordingly and give an easy 5 out of 5 stars. Until then, this is a typical GoPro camera (that's good) but don't buy it if you're going to do altitude photography.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Philip Quirino
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I bought the DJI Phantom. For such a little package it produces awesome footage as far as clarity and resolution. I down loaded the free iPhone app and that makes it even better because I can see what the camera sees.GoPro has really got it together as a company!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy for diving; housing failed on first use
Reviews.Author: Diver1
Reviews.Content: The housing failed on my first use straight out of the box at a depth of less than 40' and the camera is ruined.  GoPro inexplicably refused to replace it so I'm out the full purchase price.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed and with company support
Reviews.Author: Dad Engineer "engineer"
Reviews.Content: Bought into the whole awesomeness of the Go Pro revolution.  Made some epic videos, used it for my business documenting etc. and then it died.  And worse it died out of warranty.  The battery bulged during charging and wrecked the camera,  They sent me a new battery but that is where the customer support ended.  Done.  Paperweight.  This was supposed to be a camera that I could keep for years and bring out for those special uses.Good luck with your cams - they will die out of warranty and you will know how it feels and the awesomeness of the Go Pro will not be so awesome.

Reviews.Title: After 33 days of purchase it doesn't power on!
Reviews.Author: Brendan Hasson
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it. Just days beyond the money back guarantee the camera broke for good. Now I have to send it to the manufacturer for another one. I'd just like my money back for the camera and accessories. Totally bogus and if you look on the internet I am not the only one. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Over-Priced Novelty
Reviews.Author: Chris Reich "Business Physicist and Astronomer"
Reviews.Content: I was given one of these as a gift and I hope the giver never sees this review! I really don't care much for this camera for a number of reasons. The menu system is a nightmare. I still have to get the manual out---I have several high end digital cameras with exotic features and never need the manuals. So if you want easy, forget this thing.The most important thing a camera does is capture images and video. Here is a mixed bag. The quality if the video can be stunningly great. But the lens, designed for the ultimate selfie, is so wide that everything is shaped like a banana. That's ok, sort of. You expect novelty from a novelty camera. But I wish I could fit this camera with a lens that did not have such severe fish-eye. So you get beautiful video through the bottom of a bottle.Yes, it's small. Great if you are going to skydive and film it. For the other 99.999999% of your life, the camera is a mess to use. Turn on, start? No, menu? Stills? What 50 stills? 1 still? No, video...is it on? Can you actually turn this thing on without smudging the lens? No. It's very cumbersome to use.To retrieve images is a nightmare. Connect via usb, give it a LONG time to download OR gently fetch out the micro little memory card, put it in an adapter and then download that to your computer. I'm spoiled with pull the SD card, insert in computer, copy files I want, delete the rest. Card back in camera. If you attach by USB, you cannot delete anything on the bloody card after the lengthy process of copying to your computer. They have it protected. You have to use the bloody menu to find the trash can to delete the files which mandates another trip through menu hell.I received the 'best' unit. BUT! I never got the remote to work. I never got the app to work and I tried three tablets and a phone. Yes, I was easily able to perform the upgrade of the firmware. But the remote? Nope. Apps? Nope. So much of the money spent is wasted there. I wish it didn't have WiFi. That's something that doesn't work and if accidentally activated, drains the battery. The battery life is short as is. Which means extracting the thing from the plastic case to get at the battery, etc, etc.In all, I really don't care for this camera. I never grab it when heading out for a walk with the hounds in the woods. I mean, curved videos of my feet isn't that interesting.If you are a sports person, you might get some fun out of this thing. But for the rest of us, it's an over-priced toy that is too much bother to use. This is especially true because the high end features which could make this camera worth the trouble do not easily work. I'm sure if I had a couple hours to spend on the phone, support could resolve the WiFi issue. I just don't have the time so the whole kit is in a box in the closet waiting for me to get the time.Next year I want a good weather station please.

Reviews.Title: My First GoPro Camera
Reviews.Author: Born to Shop!
Reviews.Content: This is my first GoPro camera. We shoot lots of videos of fishing, hunting and family vacations that include snorkeling, boating, etc. Besides capturing memories to share and remember, we post a lot of fishing videos on our YouTube channel.We had the opportunity to test the GoPro 3+ Silver Edition on a recent Salmon fishing trip. We were extremely impressed on how tiny and lightweight it is. Overall battery life is decent, but I would highly recommend purchasing additional batteries to keep on hand to change out. On the average the battery lasted approximately 1.5 to 2 hours with sporadic shooting. In regards to the video quality the colors are so beautiful and crisp, but sometimes the videos comes out of focus when it comes to long distance shots. Upclose videos and stills they are impressive, they look like you are in the picture. However I noticed it most everything had a fish-eye effect which was a bit disappointing.I was extremely impressed how the audio is able to pick up so much for having such a small microphone. The housing is quite a protective shell I must say. It snaps tightly in place. You can exactly hear air escaping when you open it up!Connecting to the WiFi app was a bit tricky and it took me sometime to understand. The instructions in the manual were quite confusing. What it does not explain is that after installing the GoPro app, you need to go to your cellphone's "settings" menu and connect to GoPro Wireless Network (using password "goprohero") after turning it on by hitting the WiFi button twice on the camera. It is kind of the same procedure like connecting your phone to a Bluetooth device. After connecting to the GoPro network, you then have to open the GoPro app and rename the network and password and go back to your phone's setting and reconnect under the new network name. It took me a while to figure this out, but I finally connected to the WiFi app on my iPhone 5S. And what an amazing app it is. From my phone I can control everything. I can adjust the camera's image settings such as resolution, frame rate, field of view, etc. I can chose to record videos, take stills, burst shots and even timed lapsed stills. You can see the battery status and even view all your videos on the SD card and delete the ones you don't want. All this from my iPhone - honestly without the app I don't think I would not like the camera.Overall I give it 3 stars because of the ingenious design and the incredible mobile app, but it loses stars for the eye-fish effect that comes out on most what is captured.

Reviews.Title: Great camera when it works
Reviews.Author: Jeremy E. Kryvanis
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to get a GoPRO ever since I started seeing the awesome action shots show up on the web. I finally decided to pull the trigger recently for an upcoming backpacking trip I had. I bought all the accessories I needed, an extra battery, a high speed micro SD card, and was ready to go.While I was backpacking everything seemed to be working great. The remote and phone apps were both triggering records or pictures as expected, the battery lasted about as long as I would have hoped, and the accessories made this device truly awesome.Things went downhill from there. When I got home to review the videos, I found that they  have a feature that cuts videos up into sections. Which at first didn't seem like much of a problem. However what I found was that every second section of a video recording would not play. I would get a black screen with no audio. I searched the web up and down to figure out what was going on. Apparently this is a normal problem, usually due to cheaper/slower SD cards. However I checked and double checked to make sure the SD card I had was compatible and it was.I eventually tried 3 different solutions on how to recover the video. From what people were saying online, the only thing that was missing was the file headers for the avi files it generates. The files were 2+ gigs each, so I know the video was there. I just had no way to view it.After failing at every attempt to see the video I recorded, I gave up and returned the GoPro.I may one day try this product again, but I am very very disappointing I lost all that video from my trip.

Reviews.Title: Finally, a GoPro you can love for a while
Reviews.Author: Pablo Castro "Man of Surprises"
Reviews.Content: Everyone loved the GoPro look from the very start, and anyone who used one, hated these camera's battery life. Well, they FINALLY did them right. Walked around with this thing for an entire day doing occasional video shots and sequential photographs. As is the usual with GoPros, once in a while I'd discover the camera had accidentally switched on, which usually meant your battery was soon gone. Well, this baby lasted the entire 10 hour day, and had a bit left over.As far as the camera, the low-light sensitivity is jaw-dropping. Noise is not really noise: it's grain. Yes, grain. It looks awesome!

Reviews.Title: Over-hyped product
Reviews.Author: D.L.
Reviews.Content: The GoPro Hero 3+ Black is an OK product compared to other action camcorders out there but it's not worth $400. It gets really hot when used even for a short amount of time. The video quality is not that good, even though on paper, the specs indicate terrific video. When used without the waterproof case, the mic produces too much noise. The Hero 3+ Black is a product priced four times more than it should be.

Reviews.Title: Beware of the focus issue
Reviews.Author: Henry weekend warrior
Reviews.Content: Not sure I got a lemon or the focus issue with Hero 3+ is still out there.  I waited until May 2014 to make sure that I would get a new stock.  The focus issue has supposedly been fixed by GoPro but the Hero 3+ black unit that I got from amazon appeared to have similar focus issue and the images were not sharp, even though the serial number/batch was in H3B+B1213xxxxxx range.  Will be returning it to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Go Pro will NOT float
Reviews.Author: Pam Smith
Reviews.Content: Can't say that I can write an informed review because after buying the Go Pro (and head strap) for an adventure kayaking trip the Go Pro was swallowed by the Pacific Ocean. Our kayak capsized and this camera (and all footage) was lost. Just wanted to warn others to attach a floater!

Reviews.Title: It's a GoPro Hero3+ Black!
Reviews.Author: Matt J
Reviews.Content: Not much more needs to be said. Totally awesome camera for filming whatever you want really. Of course the sound recording is not great but is you want to use an external mic you can certainly get some better sound recording. But honestly I put music to everything I record with my GoPros so sound isn't a big deal to me. Picture and video quality, speed of recording, are unrivaled. Best small sports camera on the market hands down.

Reviews.Title: Out Of Sight!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark B Boike
Reviews.Content: What an awesome camera. Great picture quality, multiple applications, and multiple settings for taking just about any kind of video you want. So versatile I can't even begin to explain. I know almost nothing about photography or taking videos, but this is so easy to learn and use, dare I say it's idiot proof. I can only imagine what it can do in the hands of someone who really knows how to use it. I purchased the optional roll bar mount and for the first use I mounted it to the engine guard of my Road Glide. Everyone knows how much Harleys shake, especially when they're standing still, but I couldn't even tell in the video. Going to buy a chest / back mount for my dog and a mount for my R/C helicopter. Oh, I can't wait to play!!!! If you don't have one, get one, and find something to shoot. You'll be glad you did. ;-) !

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Jorge R.
Reviews.Content: It's simply the greatest camera ever. Setup is not that user friendly, and the video editor is not so great either, but the camera gets amazing pictures and videos

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Pablo Sanchez
Reviews.Content: My first gopro, I had my doubts, but it works perfectly. Is one of those products you feel that people that makes them actually thinks about the customer experience...

Reviews.Title: Good camera but seriously overpriced
Reviews.Author: R. Hayden "RH"
Reviews.Content: Got the camera for my son's Christmas.  He's 19 and pretty excited about it.  The first time he used it the plastic mount attached to his longboard snapped and he almost lost the camera in the water.  GoPro will not replace the part because we did not buy it directly from them.  Kinda petty, I thot.It's a fairly wide-angle, fish-eye type of lens.  No zoom is available.  It's great for that "up close" action video.  Not so great for group activities.  Perfect for jumpin' out of a plane, surfin', bikin', etc...Pretty happy with the camera but there are lots of alternatives out for much less money - if you're not concerned about having "THE BRAND" on your camera.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work out for me
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this is a great gadget to have for sports and POV action. But I wanted a waterproof video camera for my outdoor adventures like hiking and camping. It felt like a toy, and with the waterproof case, the audio is completely useless.Don't get me wrong it's a great gadget, easy setup, it just didn't work for what I was going to do.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: K. Douglas
Reviews.Content: I have only tested this camera and cannot speak on many features, but the picture quality is great. The view range or area that it picks up is more that what I expected. This is a small powerhouse of a camera I'll say.

Reviews.Title: The WiFi remote control  didn't work
Reviews.Author: Valera
Reviews.Content: The WiFi remote control  didn't work, noticed when already was in Europe, it was necessary to pay for repair.The camera is good.

Reviews.Title: Best GoPro to date, the Plus (+) is well deserved,
Reviews.Author: C. Weaver
Reviews.Content: The GoPro HERO3+: Black Edition is a step up on the Hero 3 in a number of ways.The camera itself is nearly identical to it predecessor, the only visible changes other than the moniker are movement of the internal microphone from the left side to the top and slightly different looking lens as the upgraded sensor and lens combination improves sharpness significantly and although the specs for the lens are the same f2.8 and 6 element I found noticeable improved low light sensitivity as well as better clarity in bright sunlight. The still photo resolution is 12MP with improved barrel distortion and a new SuperView mode provides better widescreen images vs a more fisheye look without post processing.WiFi signal strength is much better in my tests with faster downloads of images and movies to the smartphone app and less latency in preview mode.The combination of a higher capacity battery and reported software improvements increased battery life from about 1.5 hours to 2 hours of video. However I still was unable to get much longer time lapse than just shooting straight video. One downside of the new battery is a physical change that removed a couple small indents on the back side upper corners. While the new and old batteries work equally well in either the Hero3 or Hero3+, the new battery will not fit in my 3rd party Wasabi power external charger.The overall specs for the 3+ indicate the camera is 20% smaller and lighter. The camera itself is imperceptibly lighter, 2 grams at most, The changes are mostly to the case which is indeed much smaller and lighter. Internal measurements for the case are significantly smaller. So much so that the 3+ case external dimensions are smaller than the internal dimensions of the 3 case. However the change only removes unused space and both the 3 and 3+ cameras fit equally as well in either case with new new tighter fit being much more stable without the need to use any additional DIY anti rattle steps.The latching mechanism is much easier to operate and removes the secure lock which takes intentional and specific maneuvering to operate. While it is theoretically possible for the new latch to snag on something and open, in real world operation I don't think this is a significant concern.Buttons are wider, shorter, and much easier to operate and the 6 external screws holding the lens cover have been replaced with 4 internal screws.Underwater specs are not quite as good with the new case specs indicating 40m safety under the previous 60m spec, still plenty of safety margin for most use but if water intrusion is a major concern you can pick up the old style case if you don't already have it.While the Hero 3 Black edition made significant improvements to the audio quality over previous models, the Hero 3+ Black edition again steps up the quality of the audio again with much fuller full spectrum sound and clearer vocals.Slow mo can be achieved recording 240fps at WVGA, 120fps at 720, and 60fps at 1080.Firmware updates on the Hero3 could be achieved by plugging in the camera to a PC and navigating to the GoPro website which would auto detect the camera and pull the serial number for you. With the 3+ the USB connectivity seems to have been changed to read only so firmware upgrades require the user to enter in the serial number manually and download the firmware to a microSD card which you then install in the camera. This process is not difficult but I liked the fully automatic approach of the previous edition. I have read that the smartphone app is expected to add firmware update capability so this may be a short term issue.As with the Hero3, the smartphone app makes operation and feature setting super easy. Pull down menus, video preview and remote shutter operation make the GoPro a breeze to use through the free app with iOS or Android devices. Most images and video can be downloaded directly to the smartphone or tablet however some of the settings such as ProTune render the video preview inoperable while recording and remove the ability to download to your device.If you don't have a smartphone available or don't want to use it in the environment you are recording, the included remote fob gives you all the same capabilities on the camera itself including a mirror of the LCD screen so you can make any setting changes while the camera is out of reach or out of view.

Reviews.Title: iPhone and Mac Software make the GoPro sing!
Reviews.Author: Michael Trotman

} } } Length:: 0:59 MinsI originally bought the GoPro to capture the first person perspective of kitesurfing, but with no wind in over a month I had to find another use for the camera. The attached video review is a time lapse movie of the sunrise from the beach on Isle of Palms, SC November 17, 2013. GoPro makes time lapse photography a breeze using the iPhone software to set up the camera and the GoPro Studio software to convert the images to a time lapse movie.For the best out of the box experience with the camera, download the smartphone software and install the GoPro Studio on your Mac or PC. When bluetooth is activated on the camera it creates a WiFi network that you join with your phone. Once connected to the GoPro WiFi, you can use your phone to make adjustments and choose still, video, or time lapse photography. You can also use your phone as a viewfinder and frame your subject perfectly.For the attached time lapse movie, I set the "field of view" to "medium", "Photo Resolution" to "5MP MED", and the "Time Lapse" setting to "1 SEC". Once setup was complete, I set the GoPro on a small tripod and pressed "Record' from my phone and let it go for about half an hour from dawn to sunrise.I them removed the card from the camera and inserted it into the SD slot on the iMac and opened the GoPro Studio software. The software immediately recognized the card and intuitively knows to import the images as frames of a movie. The rest is very intuitive, from converting the images to a movie and then exporting to disc, Facebook, or Youtube. It's just that simple.

Reviews.Title: MUCH IMPROVED!!
Reviews.Author: James Duckett
Reviews.Content: I had the Hero Black Edition, and my biggest complaint was the battery. SO MUCH BETTER!!! My battery life is improved a lot. The camera quality is the same, but it seems to handle light a lot better now when I mount it in my car for time-lapse driving videos. And it is smaller to boot. I wish I had just waited for this one to begin with. A great little camera with a much needed tweak in the battery life compartment.

Reviews.Title: A definite improvement over the Hero3 Black Edition!
Reviews.Author: Robert C.
Reviews.Content: The GoPro HERO3+ Black Edition has very definite and noticable improvements over the HERO3 Black Edition.  Pretty much everything is better about it!  Starting with the new lens which helps the HERO3+ Black Edition produce much sharper video than before, with better, more lifelike color, better saturation, better contrast and truer white balance (say goodbye to the yellow cast!).  It also has better low light performance with better clarity and color accuracy than before at night and in light challenged situations.  The new microphones and audio system produce video with waaaay clearer, much more accurate and dynamic audio.  The HERO3+ Black Edition has about a 20~25% improved battery life/charge thanks to both a higher capacity battery and better power consumption.  The WIFI speed and range have been dramatically improved thanks to a new WIFI chip.  In my experience, I get a range increase of close to five times that of Hero3 Black Edition.  Even the waterproof case has been improved as it is about 20% smaller, with a much-easier-to-use latch system and much-easier-to-use buttons.  Additionally, the HERO3+ Black Edition has a new super wide angle mode called SuperView which gives you the widest viewing angles yet.  GoPro has really been listening to the user community and these improvements make an already great live-action camera even better!If you do pick one up, be certain to purchase a GOOD, FAST MicroSD card.  I highly recommend the Samsung 64GB Pro microSDXC(MB-MGCGB/AM) card.  I have had zero problems with it in my HERO3 or HERO3+.  I have had problems with SanDisk Ultra 64GB cards and cannot recommend them (I have friends who have also had issues with SanDisk Ultra cards in their GoPros).For those of you who are concerned about the talk of a "focus issue" with the HERO3+ Black Edition mentioned in some reviews, I suggest that you don't listen to the negative reviews without checking out the comment section of this review for links to direct head to head video comparisons of the HERO3+ Black Edition vs the HERO3 Black Edition (I can't post links in the main review).  These videos feature side by side HD footage taken by both cameras at the exact same time using special rigs.  Judge for yourself.  Again, click the comments button below for the URLs.

Don't expect an Apple product expereince where it's good to go out of the box.On the other hand, once it's set up, it's amazing! I took this to shark diving in South Africa. Also tried attaching it to a DJI Phantom drone. Both were just phenomenal in terms of footage (wide angle lens), and quality of video. So I guess once it's set up, the rest is all yours. Battery life is not that bad honestly, and I love how you can control it with your phone. Wish the wifi range is better, but one step at a time. =)

Reviews.Content: Bought this to arrive on the same day I was leaving for diving and water activities in Mexico and this camera performs!  Great pictures and videos right out of the box! Luckily we found a memory card in Mexico to slide our micro SD into so we could move the photos from the card (trying to do this from the camera directly didn't work. Reviews.Title: nice, tough camera
Reviews.Author: physicistkev
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet.  Great camera.  Have used it for underwater slow speed (720p 120f/s) with my kids and it is fantastic.  My primary use is for recording on track footage while on a motorcycle.  It's already been through a nasty crash and came out without a scratch.  Captured the whole crash, which is an issue on the GoPro 960 I also have.  The camera is small, light and is usable as a handheld if you use the narrow setting.  There is still some fish-eye to the frame (in narrow mode), but it is minimized and not that noticeable if the camera is moving.  It's not a replacement for a regular camera or video camera if you want a true non-distorted (fish-eye) picture, but for action sports, action in general and something that can take a thrashing, it's unbeatable.

We needed a camera that took high resolution pictures, was small and lightweight, and that could be set to continuously snap pictures every few seconds. From the literature, it appeared the Gopro Hero3 was just the thing we needed.We purchased the camera, and integrated it into our flight package. The pictures that the camera took were simply stunning, and it worked flawlessly. Battery life was sufficient to provide pictures from start to finish. In addition, it worked properly, even though ambient temperatures were around 50 degrees below zero (F).I am delighted with the camera, and I believe that it is the ultimate camera for High Altitude Ballooning.In the customer picture section above, you can see the picture that this camera took from the edge of space of the earth.

Reviews.Title: simply the best!
Reviews.Author: morning fog
Reviews.Content: I was juggling between Gopro and Sony’s actions cam. Price wise, Sony models are pretty reasonable, so I bought its AS10 to try it out. Initially, I like the video quality. It seemed crispy and the colors were vibrant. However, I quickly realized that the camera shape was a bit awkward to attach on things I like. So I bought this newer Gopro and now I am very satisfied with this little one. I was hesitant at first to buy this because I read some reviews about the blurred image quality on this + models. But then later, I also heard that they would fix this issue by updating the firmware. I trusted what the CEO said and went ahead and bought one black and one silver. After few test shootings, I reviewed the image qualities, and I was pleased and satisfied again. I didn’t expect much of good printable quality photos from this, but I have to say the video clips were just wonderful. As expected, I went through the registration and updating process once I received the camera, and after that I did not notice any image quality issues. White balances were pretty accurate and prompt when the light source changed and the colors were as neutral as it should be. GoPro might not as vibrant as Sony’s, but, personally, I prefer natural colors. Gopro claimed these + models have improved low light shooting, but in my opinion it’s not that great because all these point and shoot tiny cameras have natural born limit on low light shooting (small sensor size). However, under the bright sunny daylight, I saw plenty of details in shadow area (highlights in the sky were blown away somewhat and needed a ND or polarizer filter to fix this)What I most like about this camera is the ability of mounting. There are so many mounting accessories; I can mount this camera on almost anything I can imagine. I might be late on this new trend of POV shooting in the era of selfies and mobile devices, but wow this camera really expanded my horizons because of the accessibility and the portability. Also, I think the people at GoPro were pretty smart keeping the original form factor and it’s size when designed new versions. They only made the hard case smaller and lighter. I don’t think the upgrade from the 3s were major, yet, lighter weight and longer battery life itself would benefit many casual users like myself.Overall, I love it. This is the one that I would keep shooting things to document what I love to do. My only regret is the fact that I had not tried this earlier (think about the Gopro company is ten years old, many people still probably don’t know much about what this can do). I think the price is bit high considering the device specification, yet no other cameras have such an ability to do what this can do.

Reviews.Title: Leaps and bounds above the original
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. A.
Reviews.Content: I am an avid motorcycle enthusiast and purchased the original GoPro years ago before they were sponsoring every sporting event you can think of.  My wife purchased the Hero3+ Black Edition for me as a birthday gift and I have to say the upgrade is well worth the price.The fit and finish and size are definitely an improvement.  The buttons are more responsive and easier to push.  The menus on the camera are more intuitive and seem to make more sense, its just all around better from that perspective.  The leds on the front and top make easier to tell when its recording from more angles than just the front.Throw in the remote and and it adds a whole new level of control.  Using the quick start instructions pairing the camera and the remote was a snap.  No more taking the camera on and off, removing a helmet or chest harness or handle bars.  Just pair the remote and you are good to go.The best feature in my opinion is the cell phone app.  Again, following the instructions in quick start guide makes connecting the phone a piece of cake and once they are connected you have full control and quick access to all the settings even down to turning off the LEDs and beep feedback.  Best of all is the ability to stream real time video directly to your phone so you can get your camera setup just right.  On the original this feature wasn't available without purchasing additional hardware and I can't tell you how many hours of video I have wasted over the years due to poor setup from the start.  The app also allows you to download your videos and photos directly to your phone so you can share them almost instantly.I ordered a case, a wrist strap for the remote and additional batteries with a quick charger.  I'll post reviews for them once I receive them from Amazon and try them out during my ski trip this weekend.
