Reviews.Title: Go Pro Silver Edition
Reviews.Author: A. Luzuriaga "myword"
Reviews.Content: I got this for a gift which was used on our ski trip, to video my skiing.  We love it!

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: Isaac David Martin
Reviews.Content: Better than expected, the quality and video are amazing. Me and my kids love this little camera and all the attachments.

Reviews.Title: GoPro H3+ provides one with another view
Reviews.Author: David R. Pokorney "dpoke"
Reviews.Content: I have the head mount and have used it to videotape a couple contra dances.  What a treat to see this perspective!

Reviews.Title: I Love this camera
Reviews.Author: GREGORY A BOLDUC
Reviews.Content: I used this camera while snorkeling in the Philippines. Most excellent underwater videos, the clarity cannot be expressed enough! The screen is kind of hard to read for these old eyes but overall I Love This Camera.

Reviews.Title: Not as great as I had hoped
Reviews.Author: KHS
Reviews.Content: The picture quality and size can't be beat, but the software has some problems. Once I turned on the wireless options to allow me to control it with my Ipad or Iphone, I could not turn off the camera's power without removing the battery. This problem has been experienced by several users.Also, I was unable to view any of the pictures in the camera using the wireless option. I was not able to connect the camera to my computer using the included cable and download the images. I had to remove the memory card and download the images directly on my computer. Several calls and emails the GoPro did not resolve any of these issues. It may be due to strict requirements on the type of memory card you can use, even though I tried several types recommended on their site.Never the less, GoPro is popular due to it's amazing quality of images and size. Perhaps the software will be updated in the future.

Reviews.Title: black edition
Reviews.Author: Ryan C. Morris
Reviews.Content: we have used this go-pro for skiing and skijoring.. great quality and sound.  i am really happy with our videos, and the go-pro app makes it easy to use the camera and see what you are filming.  i don't think go-pro has an lcd bacpac that fits the 3+ yet.. but the app does the job fine.  picture quality is nice, in the super-view setting it looks kind of fish-eye but it still gives a great range of view.  we used it to film our dogs as we skijored in the late afternoon and the lighting was still good even as the sun was going down.  we are really happy with it and expect to make great videos!

Reviews.Title: A hole in one
Reviews.Author: David Knisley
Reviews.Content: What a camera for what I need it to do.  The GoPro is a mini HD camera that works well for shooting B-roll video for production type videos. Service was great, however it was on backorder for a bit, but once received it was a welcome experience.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband for Christmas this year. It is an absolutely amazing camera and he loves it. Super easy to use and the picture is pretty great. We have used it for snowboard videos, cat videos, and various time lapses. The only thing you need to know is there is no view finder on the camera, it is available for purchase, or you can sync it to your smartphone and use that, which works really well. The GoPro Hero3+ is super small too and its waterproof case is really nice, and makes it much more durable. Love this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, certain essentials missing.
Reviews.Author: Matt Franklin
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited to purchase and receive my Hero3+, and had no issues using it with my wifi devices. I did find a few things worth noting for anyone considering this camera, though.The lack of lens caps in the basic set, however, seems quite odd given how essential they are to maintaining picture quality. I was also a little disappointed to find that there is no built in feature for mounting the camera to a standard tripod mount. Lens caps and tripod adapters are available either through GoPro or off-brand services.I happen to have access to both Andriod and iOS devices for preview, live view, and playback. For anyone who does not have such devices on hand, you'll need some way to monitor your camera such as a BacPac if you have plans to film shots more complicated than strapping the camera to a helmet or leaving it in a fixed position. The super wide angle, naturally, offers some compensation for this.Speaking of the wide angle, I'm personally not too keen on the distortion it creates, so I was delighted to find that certain recording resolutions do offer narrower fields of view.Overall, an amazing piece of hardware for someone on a minimal to medium budget.

Reviews.Title: My son Loves it
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Braun
Reviews.Content: So does his Dad.  My Son has shown me already what this wonderful camera can do and since he is in training to fly I can see from his point of view what he is doing.

Reviews.Title: Incredible product....
Reviews.Author: T. Young
Reviews.Content: We got two of these for our children's families for Christmas.  My son had used a GoPro previously and loved what can be done with them.  My daughter's family had never used one, but they went to Montana skiing during the holidays and thoroughly enjoyed getting acquainted with it during that trip.  It's quite amazing...but the comment I always seem to hear is how great the pictures are.  It is incredible how crisp and stable the results are regardless of the duress put on the camera.  We're extremely pleased with how much enjoyment the GoPro gift have brought our kids and grandkids.  Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Angel Peltekov
Reviews.Content: I recommend this camera because it fits for every kind of use. It is small and light, but the quality is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Best Action Camera
Reviews.Author: H3avenlyK3rby
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend. He absolutely loves it. He wants to do more outdoor activities so he can use the camera. The first video we took was of the dog tugging on his chew toy. One of the coolest features of this camera is the remote operating that you can do via your Android device or tablet. You can even get apps for it on the Apple store if you have an Apple device. The video editing software that GoPro provides you with works really well. It is a fun and tough little camera.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: Walter E Dann
Reviews.Content: Arrived in new package just like the description. Bought for diving trip just wish it had a  tripod mount. All in all  was a good deal no sales tax.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it
Reviews.Author: michael allen
Reviews.Content: I had the first gopro camera and loved it so i figured it was time to update and get the hero3+ and im happy to say the improvements are very nice clearer recording and much better night filming. Since i use it to record my drives i cant comment on the wifi streaming option of the device but so far what its made to do it does well and the battery held out on a 3hr drive. The only complaint i have and i dont know whos at fault gopro or the sdcard is how very long video is split up on the sdcard after the 2hr how you will have 3 or 4 separate files and you will need to use a video editing software to piece it together.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted--slo mo and HD
Reviews.Author: William R. Harvey "harveywaz"
Reviews.Content: But it took a little more than I expected to get it.  I wanted to film my golf swing and I had the idea that I could just shoot at a high frame rate and then it would show up as slow motion on the computer screen.  Turns out it has to be processed by the Studio software to get the full effect.  However, the 30 frames per second shooting is great, and can be displayed immediately.  The wide angle is great, too, because I use it to take pictures of houses and condos I have re-habbed, and it can show the whole room in one shot.  There's so much more to this camera than I have been able to explore yet, and I'm looking forward to expanding my knowledge of it's applications, and uses.  Oh, and be sure to download the GoPro app for your iPhone or Android--makes it easier to manipulate the settings on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good cam for action
Reviews.Author: mohammed saif
Reviews.Content: I loved. This came met my requirement. If planing to buy action camera go for GoPro Hero3+ Black Edition.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Really Cool
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I was worried about the stabilizer of GoPro3+ but at the end it resulted to be really stable and capable to fly on my DJI Phantom, i'm actually learning, maybe I need to buy/make a gyroscope or something. But the goPro itself its very very cool, downloaded the app from the appStore and it works perfect with the gopro's WiFi :D happy, happy, happy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for active lifestyle
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Got Hero 3+ Silver to replace a previous underwater camera that offed itself after one too many deeper snorkel dives.  Personally, I think the Silver version provides 85% of the benefit most people will need from their Go Pro, but if you are super serious about this stuff maybe go for Black for advanced settings and higher res settings.  Everyone else, save the cash - this thing rocks.First, upgrading firmware, software is pretty easy if you have basic computer skills - dont be nervous - follow website/Amazon review instructions and it will be easy, as will be wireless setup.  Go Pro App is sweet - can control camera, preview, review footage all immediately on phone through wireless.  Be aware though - wireless range is pretty limited - not sure but Go Pro wireless remote might have longer range - seems to based on advertising.  We used this for trip to Dominican Republic, primarily for snorkeling, but also general photos and vids.  Default 960p/60 fps (think its 60 fps) vid (can go to 1080p too) is awesome and the camera does pretty well in low light - adjusts quick - I placed the camera several times under a coral outcrop (get the clear Go Pole - must have accessory) and in seconds it adjusted and captured great footage.  Def does better closer to object than far away in regards to detail, but as long as you dont expect super zoom type of detail, it will meet your needs.  As others have noted, lens does impart somewhat of a fish eye type of effect, but nothing that made me terribly upset.  10mp pics came out nice - once again, closer to subject better.  Time lapse and burst are awesome for catching the perfect shot in a dynamic situation.  Housing is well made and camera and housing are durable.  No problem down to 25 feet snorkeling and rated to like 90+.  Antifog inserts a must for underwater or humid conditions.  Battery life was excellent - I found myself able to have the camera on and filming on and off for at least an hour and then be able to review footage on phone through wireless for at least 30 min before battery gave out - get Wasabi backups and charger - seems to work just fine with Go Pro battery - charging through USB is a pain to me.  Would also be nice to be able to effectively transfer stuff to PC through wireless, but at size of vids and pics easier to just remove from housing and do through USB.

Reviews.Title: good price
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Fallis
Reviews.Content: great package price still trying to learn to use it but it is pretty simple  the hardest part is learning how to see what you have made pictures of

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Leroy
Reviews.Content: Camera was as expected and meets my expectations.Battery life is very low if you use the Go Pro iPhone app.

Reviews.Title: Surprise
Reviews.Author: sheila
Reviews.Content: My son does long distance bike rides.  On Christmas morning this gift surprised him and made him Very Happy..Looking forward to seeing some great videos and stills.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: DKH "KDH"
Reviews.Content: There is little that I can add to the thousands of other +++ reviews about GoPro! in the weeks that I have had the 3+, it has been underwater, buried in sand and gravel, tossed into a piece of mining equipment with a shovel and almost bounced off the hood of my truck (Thank you tether line for the save) and works perfect!.Been shooting a lot of 4K stuff for giggles and it is incredible for what it is. My only kinda sorta slightly negative is that the super wide default setting is really WIDE. Which is great for some but for my needs it is just too much. Oh but wait a couple of presses of the menu and its onto something more usable for me.I have a couple of these this is the first 3+ and I will be getting a few more.

Reviews.Title: super camera
Reviews.Author: Asaad Saleh
Reviews.Content: A great update to the hero 3 black which i own previously, the housing is smaller, same camera size, the screen fits well but the back door of the screen didn't.the wifi is better, i still to test the battery.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: cheryl
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband for Christmas.  He loves it.  Now he's trying to figure out all the things he can mount it to when participating in sporting or outdoor activites.  He keeps thanking me for it, and it was a month ago.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, wonderful, great pics and videos
Reviews.Author: Carey Ailor
Reviews.Content: love love love it!!! took to the beach and was great to play with on vacation.  Loved the pics and videos

Reviews.Title: Excelent !!!
Reviews.Author: Max Arturo Cedeno Gutierrez "mcedeno"
Reviews.Content: Excelent !!!Yes.. !!! The camera is excellent. The quality of this camera is remarkable.. amazing, Good camera for this price, ?

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: Heft
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. The right size...takes great video. Go to there website and see for yourself. I'm using mine for scuba diving in Bonaire.

Reviews.Title: Quadcopter FPV ( first person view) and high quality video all in one.
Reviews.Author: Peter Sinclair
Reviews.Content: Wow, now I know why the price is high.  The quality easily justifies the cost. Shoot YouTube video and still photos all at the same time.  Also serves as an FPV camera on my quadcopter and planes..

Reviews.Title: A great toy
Reviews.Author: Bob Huddleston
Reviews.Content: A great upgrade.  It works as advertised, Captures good video in low light.  We took it swimming with the whales and plan some more trips to visit our watery friends.

Reviews.Title: Fun, easy, and unbelievable quality video!
Reviews.Author: carol m davis
Reviews.Content: My first GoPro, I love it!  I bought it to video my first Tough Mudder run and it performed amazingly!  I bought the battery bacpac so that I wouldn't run out of power on my run which lasted two hours.  Here's the video I made http://youtu.be/LS4OcuOGdZ4I shot my video at 1080p 60fps and it blew my mind when I watched it on my hi-def TV.  YouTube compresses their video's so you can't really appreciate the quality of this little camera.I plan on recording all of my "mud runs" and posting on facebook for family and friends to see.I used the head strap and took it off when I jumped in the water (didn't want to lose it).  I plan on making family video's this holiday season and will use the iPhone wifi monitoring App, very cool, it allows to watch live and has easy access to change settings, take photo's, etc.You can't go wrong with this little beast.  I just ordered the Handicam Smoothie, GoPro floaty, and LCD bacpac, I'm excited to play with this thing.

Reviews.Title: Impressive video quality, even in low light. Awesome app!
Reviews.Author: P. Colin McGraw "AV, Computer & EnviroTech Nut"
Reviews.Content: I'm amply impressed by this camera, and the entire experience GoPro created! Basically, you pop in a micro SD card (not included), download an app for you phone, and you can start transferring photos and controlling the camera with the app (iOS, Android or Windows Mobile), which connects to the HERO3+ as if it were a WiFi hotspot.You see a live video feed (delayed by a second or two) right in the app, and there are controls to transfer and otherwise manage photos and video.The first video I shot was actually in my basement in low light, and the picture and audio came out smooth, detailed and crystal clear! The wide angle lens allows a good view of whatever you're filming (or interesting close ups) and there are modes for camera, burst camera or video.It all comes in a waterproof case (which must be removed for charging) that is supposed to be submersible up to 131 feet!This is a gadget that is hard not to geek out about. It's truly awesome and (I dare say) fun to use!The main drawback is that it all but requires you buy accessories. You can't get around buying a Micro SD card (which is forgivable), but you might end up having to buy a Micro HDMI cord, Micro SD adapter, and possible additional mounts to make full use of the camera. At least it comes with some simple adhesive mounts to stick onto a helmet or possibly whatever you're riding on.At any rate, I highly recommend the HERO3+!

Reviews.Title: Superview changes video
Reviews.Author: Alex Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a camera to use while skydiving and snowboarding and it did not disappoint. The battery life is much improved and the better designed case is great. What really makes it worth it is the new superview mode. This mode records even wider then the normal hd setting and is great for anything outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Great 4K action camera that provides fantastically looking sharp pictures and videos, full of features
Reviews.Author: Denis Vukosav
Reviews.Content: I received GoPro HERO3+ camera to use it for few days to be able to write review and in general this is best camera you can get for your money.First of all, it's full of feature that people who are involved in sports or some adventurous discipline will especially appreciate, and with its view field of 170° or 120° enables even to record 4K video at 15 frames per second.Second, this camera comparing to its previous models and its competition as well, in this price category, regardless of whether it's day or night shooting, is way ahead providing fantastically looking sharp pictures and videos.Its design wasn't changed a lot, besides it's a bit thinner and lighter, being waterproof and having locking mechanism that is better than in previous models.The user will have ability to use its mini USB and Micro HDMI ports, the 3.5mm microphone jack is missing, although adapter cable can be additionally bought.Also the media format has changed, instead of normal SD cards, this new camera edition is using Micro SD cards, with capacity up to the 64GB.Its operation is still the simplest possible, having only three buttons, one for start/stop shooting, second for settings and menu navigation and the last one for turning Wi-Fi on/off.It would need lot of space to describe all of its shooting settings, but most important user can choose between 4 shooting modes: Movie, Timelapse, Burst and Still.Its only drawback is battery life that I was able to use only for about 90 minutes recording at 1080p resolution that is a bit or even much lower than competition.Therefore purchasing of additional batteries and Battery BakPak is recommended.GoPro HERO3+ is great action camera, probably the best one ever made, perfect for people who need device that will record their adventurous events.Therefore I can fully recommend it to all such people taking into account its price and need for additional batteries that still don't reduce the overall excellent impression.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy!
Reviews.Author: Don W. Stauffer
Reviews.Content: This is a definite "don't buy".  Strange blotches in 720 resolution, and it's like a series of stills rather than video.  1080 is the best but definitely has the "strobe" effect of HD cameras and TVs whose hardware isn't fast enough.  Higher resolutions than that force you to use the "Medium" or "Wide" field width which distorts things like a fisheye lense - straight lines are curved.  Also very expensive when you count the accessories you have to get: $200 SD card, $80 LCD display, neither of which come with even the Black Edition!  This could have been a good camera.  It will be going back.

Reviews.Title: WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY
Reviews.Author: Dr Michael Corradino
Reviews.Content: What a waste of money. A product that works like this should NOT cost this much!!I've used the camera on a few occasions. Being and avid free-diver and scuba diver, I really wanted to love this camera. I even took it on my last snowboarding trip. That's when the troubles started. Even though I kept it charging all night, it didn't even charge one bit. After trying to charge it for weeks I had to return it.Second camera, my first trip to Greece - lots of free diving and scuba diving. Camera died on my second dive. That's when I got really pissed off and started looking for solutions online. Turns out - this is a common problem. Once your camera dies, it's dead. There's hundreds of videos on YouTube with solutions to the problem and if you have patience and a few different cords you might just get lucky. But for equipment that costs over $300 I definitely expected more. And should've done a lot more research.Yes, yes, with the proper casing you can use it underwater. Guess what, with proper casing you can even use your iPhone under water. Or even your camera. And you wouldn't have to buy yet another camera that you'd have to charge (when it charges). One more thing I HATE about it - I had to buy a card reader in order to view my content! Every device I use nowadays is recognized by my Mac/PC/whatever when I plug it in via USB. NOT GOPRO. So the only way to get your content with GoPro is to PURCHASE a MicroSD card and then PUCHASE a card reader. A whole lot of waste of money for a crappy product. I can't stress my disappointment enough.

Reviews.Title: Didn't Even Work CRAP
Reviews.Author: wesley wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this product for my best friend for Christmas. Couldn't wait for the look on his face when he opened it. Took it out of the box he put the battery in it automatically started smelling like it was catching on fire and kept turning off and on.

Reviews.Title: Buggy.  Can' even review
Reviews.Author: richard lieberman
Reviews.Content: The hero 3 +Black corrupted the San disk 32 G card immediately.  I thought that it was the card.  I exchanged it,  and the second card got corrupted immediately.  I called Go Pro.  I was told to download a firmware update.  But I could not download anything,  since the download requires a non-corrupted card.  Searching the blogs,  i found that many people had a similar problem. This is astounding for such a popular,  and pricey,  device.  At this point I cannot tell whether or not it is the card,  the camera,  or both.  I will update this review after I get another card  (NOT San Disk),  and I update the firmware.  Go Pro should put a note in all the cameras  "Update  Firmware".  But some of the bloggers say the updates are not so helpful...  I have read about the poor distance focusing,  but I can't even write about this,  because the camera only gives an error message  ("No Disk").  I wanted to hike and ski tomorrow,  but I first have to get a new card;  download firmware, and hope i works.Also:  The remote on this unit has a bizarre feature.  When it is finished charging,  it turns itself on,  and then stops charging.  So if you plug it in,  and charge it overnight,  it is uncharged in the morning.  This is fantastically stupid!  I spoke to tech support,  and they politely told me that they have been informed of this glitch..So what to do?  Go Pro is heavily marketed,  and I see people with them all the time,  and they don't seem to be frustrated.  But digging a little deeper shows that there are some real problems

Reviews.Title: More of a novelty than anything else but it's a cool concept.
Reviews.Author: Clayton A. Cohn
Reviews.Content: I rated this three stars because the GoPro is something that is really cool, but honestly not necessary unless you use it a lot for things like skydiving, skiing/snowboarding, surfing, etc.Pros: Great video/photo quality and camera/wifi/remote/app/computer integration.Cons: Very pricey.Bottom Line: This product is great for anyone who engages is adrenaline-pumping activities on a REGULAR basis. If you are only going to use it once or twice a year, it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Water leak. Don't use it underwater
Reviews.Author: Irwin Cua
Reviews.Content: I used my go pro with the waterproof casing  for snorkeling for the first time  and noticed water leaking into the camera after 15 minutes of use.  Camera is not working anymore.  I made sure the rubber seal was clean and I closed the backdoor properly before use.  I returned this to the dealer/service center for go pro but they did not want to accept it even if camera is still under warranty, they told me that for any water leak issues I have to contact go pro directly via email.  I emailed go pro regarding this matter and no response.  Don't buy this camera if you are planning to use it  underwater, casing is not waterproof.You can check this link  http://youtu.be/2MKQF4mWnQI

Reviews.Author: Gina B. "It's a dry heat!"

I'm not an extreme sports person, but I used it in trees in my yard to remotely capture hummingbirds and other wildlife. It's small and unobtrusive, so the animals don't know it's there. Using the mobile app with it (as a remote) is really cool and allows you to start and stop the camera whenever you need to - without taking it out of it's housing.I did run into some overheating issues with it here in Arizona - when filming inside it's case in the sun, it barely made it 20-30 minutes without shutting down due to heat. I can imagine this would be a pain when hiking in the sun or in hotter locations in the summer. However, after a brief rest, the camera was ready to go again.The button that works the controls needs to be simplified - I understand they were trying to make it have as few openings on the body as possible, but having several buttons (an OK button) or a wheel would make selecting options so much easier. I found it frustrating to cycle through the menus with one button and select with the other - then when in the next menu you'd have to remember which button did what again. That's why I knocked off a star.

Reviews.Title: Silver Edition not what I expected.
Reviews.Author: J_RoK "J_Rok"
Reviews.Content: Review of Silver Edition.Not sure if I got a dud or I'm doing something wrong but the video on 1080p 60 if extremely grainy & does not look good at all. I figured the Silver + would be similar to the last model of the black but it looks terrible. I am returning the Silver + to REI, not sure if I want to buy the Black +, especially since I missed out on the 20% off deal by buying the silver the first time around.

Reviews.Title: Hero 2 works way better
Reviews.Author: Geared Up
Reviews.Content: Between poor focusing, poor battery life, and just generally dissatisfied with a product that had so much hype behind it. You can contact gopro for a replacement / adjustment. But really, they should pull their heads from where the sun dont shine.Update:So a new problem that has creeped up. The gopro will stick you micro sd card in write protect mode. To overcome this you must right click on the gopro drive and open up as a portable device. Also it may make it the card unformattable. Just a heads up.

Reviews.Title: Fun Action Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter D.
Reviews.Content: Prior to the Hero 3 Silver Edition I had the Hero 2 HD 1080 and was delighted since I post my video's after editing them to Youtube and show my family and friends the end result.1080HD quality scores a .................... 9/10 ( in optimized lighting )Video in low light contitions .................3/10 ( scores poorly and film quality is bad )Video is great when you play around with the settings and again people you really need to know how to (toggle) use the Menu button well to understand all its features.The wide angle is great if you like that curved, wild look however if you don't like that angle you can change it from 170 to 127 deg and all of a sudden the field of view is more horizontal..........:)The camera has been used for fishing, disc golfing, mountain biking, hiking, underwater filming and interviews and typically has outshined many more expensive cameras.The GoPro website indicates that when filming for mountain biking use the 960HD however we found out that in this setting the camera, for some reason, cannot set the lighting quick enough in and out of shadow.  This makes for a grainy over exposed video, something I don't want to spend hours of filming thank you.( FYI- The Hero 3 does NOT have STABILIZATION however there are computer programs that do offer it when you edit your movie clips using your PC or Desk Top )The herky jerky movements of the camera are so disapointing and my Canon SX160 at 720HD does have Image Stabilization of course getting it to mount on my helmet is a challenge lolThe batteries are supposed to last up to 2 hours....................NOT !!  I dont think so GoPro!! More like 1.3 hours if that.The clear plastic exoskeleton casing is $50 of you break the one you bought the camera in so be gentle....lolTry not to scratch the lens cover because it will distort your film quality too.  When the light hits the scratch, nick, ding, dent, gouge etc it will distort the light and over expose your video filming.Still camera is washed out everytime and I have to always use the (highlight) feature to dim the over exposed pictures.( MAKE SURE THAT THE OUTSIDE LENS COVER -AREA- IS ALWAYS CLEAN ) if not you will be sorry later!!Micro SD card is a great idea for a ( midgit ) with tiny fingers or perhaps a ( hobbit ) but for the average dude not a good idea.The itsy, bitsy, teenie, tiny, biddy little door has no tether to keep it attached to the camera in the first place.Now for $400 (Black Edtition) with Wifi Remote - most people lose the darn thing or Fluffy eats it !!What, no LCD screen on the back? Are you kidding me? LAME!Now for $300 (Silver Edition ) without Remote but still Wifi not all phones work with the Wifi which is so very disappointing!!This is what you should get for $300Camera Exoskeleton case (2nd one for 50% off)LCD on back of camera12 univeral mount pieces2 suction cup mountsLens Cap ( Housing Lens Cover )1 - LCD Screen ProtectorLens Screws and seal (replacement kit)For people to have to keep paying for the smallest cheapest part gives us all the impression that GoPro is getting cheaper and cheaper and eventually will get so so cheap they will become a distant memory.  I heard that some of the well known camera companies are launching their own action cameras this summer.  GoPro may be put to the test for some of these action cameras will come with what is mentioned above for the same price and with a higher megapixel quality and zoom feature too.

Reviews.Title: PC Connection Issues
Reviews.Author: Andrei Petrov
Reviews.Content: I have on-going issues associated with connection of "white edition" to any of my PCs. I tried with both Windows XP and Windows 7. On Windows XP, the computer prompts me to reformat the microSD card, and then says that it cannot proceed with reformatting. On Windows 7, the camera is recognized, but after a very short period of time the connection "freezes", with no more response from the camera. In this case, after camera is unplugged, the only way to turn it off is to physically remove the battery. For some reason, the camera designers even did not foresee some sort of "reset" button.I contacted gopro customer service several times - first, they recommended to update the firmware - I did it - no positive result. Then, they advised me to format microSD card using camera itself every time after I connect to PC (!!!). Although this procedure sounds very strange, mildly speaking, I nevertheless tried it - again, with no positive result. So, the only way to transfer the data from this camera is via actual insert of microSD into PC.And here comes another problem. When I use this camera as a dash cam, the so-called "naked frame", which is the most suitable for that type of application, has an opening only enough to attach/remove USB cable, but not the card. In order to make the card removable without taking off the frame, I had to enlarge the opening using small file. Certainly, this is not a big deal, but I wonder why camera designers did not foresee such an elementary thing that at some point of time the microSD card should be taken out?On the positive side, I can give a credit for video/photo quality - these are acceptable for me. But there is still lots of room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: Wow. So impressive!!
Reviews.Author: Marino Shauye
Reviews.Content: This is my first GoPro camera. Wow. It won't be my last!Since I haven't had much experience with them in the past, I asked a friend if I could see his GoPro 2 to offer some comparison. Here's a quick rundown of differences between the second series and the GoPro 3+:- So much slimmer! The GP2 is about 1 3/8" thick (inc. lens) and the GP3+ is 1 1/8" thick (inc. lens).- Bigger buttons on the GP3+, so easier to operate, especially if you have bigger fingers.- The GP2 uses SD cards, and the GP3+ micro SD.- Battery life is far superior on the GP3+. Though I have not yet run through a complete cycle (since plugging it into the computer seems to be charging it too), the GP3+ battery has never run low yet, and anecdotally, my friend said the GP2 battery didn't have the same lasting power.Picture quality is incredible. The HD video won't even play smoothly on my older computer (time for a new computer, it would seem) and that is not even at the best resolution. On a newer computer, the videos are super high-quality and I am in awe by the clarity and color.The wide-angle lens is perfect for all of your adventures. Image stabilization is also superb. And surprisingly good sound, even from within the protective case.The display on the camera still suffers the same simplicity (read: a little hard to use) as the GP2, but it doesn't take long to figure out how to move through it and make your selections.But here is where the 3+ (black edition) rocks. GoPro has an app you can install on your phone or tablet, and not only does that turn your mobile device into a remote, it is also a preview screen and a way to easily go through the menu like any other app. Five stars for that alone! Connecting is very easy too.The remote that comes with it is also handy so you don't have to mess with the camera once it's mounted in place, and much easier to carry on your adventure than an iPad. :)The photo/video features are really cool. I have so far only played with the regular video mode and the 30 shots/sec option. That is pretty darn cool. Once I have a computer that has the computing power to process the files, I will be installing the GoPro editing software to make cool things happen.I still have a lot of adventuring to do with this camera, but so far it gets two thumbs up! Planning on getting the suction cup accessory so it can go for a ride stuck to the car. Oh, and a helmet mount! And, and... Sky's the limit with this one.

Reviews.Title: GoPro Silver 3+ a photographers perspective
Reviews.Author: Chris Zee Shutterbug
Reviews.Content: 10/21 Update. My comparison pebble driveway photos appear to be up again. Canon 10mp @16mm focused at 14 ft for resolution comparison. Silver 3+ best focus appears at 5-10 ft. If possible Zoom in to see distance marks. They are black text on the left side at 14 ft, 35ft and 150ft.10/30 Update. Some people have asked how hot does the camera get. I have measured 118.5 deg F. The hottest spot when looking at the front of the camera is the upper left of the black border around the lens.There has been a lot of discussion recently regarding the improved lens statement for the GoPro 3+, mostly Black edition, but the same lens description applies to the Silver+ edition. The questions are regarding whether the sharpness claim refers to up close focus at the expense of further back focus. I don't have the previous 3 non plus version, but I am very happy with the photo results of the silver 3+ and decided to do some tests and to answer some common questions based on these tests. As a comparison I used an older Canon XTI camera which has an identical resolution 10mp (although much larger physically) sensor. For those that want a quick summary, the GoPro 3+ Silver appears to have its optimum focus point at about 5ft. By about 15ft you cannot distinguish anything smaller than about ¼ inch. I was going to post comparison photos which I took of a 150 ft long concrete gravel driveway but it looks like the on again off again policy of posting user images is off again. Suffice it to say you could tell exactly where the best focus is by looking at where the pebbles are the sharpest. Other photographer oriented comments; In EXIF the camera reports itself as a 2.77mm f2.8 lens with a 16mm equivalent 35mm focal length. In all the light conditions I used it, it tried to keep the ISO at 100, but indoors it jumped up to ISO 350 and 1/6 sec. In bright sun I got exposures as short as 1/3425 second which is very quick.The comparison lens I used on the Canon was a 10mm (at f5.6 to attempt to compensate for the larger sensor and to get more comparable depth of field) which also has a 16mm equivalent in 35m world. I found the angle of coverage of the GoPro to be slightly better than 16mm though, I would estimate more like 14mm. When I focused the Canon manually to ~5ft is where the details and sharpness of the two cameras was most comparable. Shooting the perfectly gray concrete in bright sunlight the GoPro color balance was slightly on the green side. The sky comes out a spectacular blue, reds in flowers and green of grass seems muted. The manual on pg 32 describes that white balance can be accessed from the capture settings, yet my 1.07 firmware version did not have this option. Landscape photos were very well exposed, I did not have any blown highlights, however the contrast does appear to be on the high side.In my test photos I did confirm that the compression algorithm seems to smear a lot of details, especially when you go beyond the ~10ft distance, yet surprisingly the photos averaged 4.5MB (EXIF reported 2.4-3.5 BPP compression), while the Canon 10mp photos (med quality) were averaging 2.3MB. At the same the smaller file size Canon photos retained significantly more detail at 20+ft distances. One amazing observation, the Silver 3+ had very little to no chromatic aberation or purple fringinging in high contrast areas, it was much better than the Canon with the 10-22mm lens.The GoPro App for WiFi (android version) worked really well although at times I had to start it up twice when it said preview mode not supported. Outdoors I got an incredible 180ft range with it. Preview is only slightly choppy, maybe half second delay when you move. Note that the camera runs appreciably warm but not hot when the WiFi is enabled.Overall I had a blast with the camera. I would have preferred slightly longer optimum focus distance, settable compression quality, backlight on the lcd, and white balance that truly appears in the menu. Finally if you are on the fence between the Black and the Silver, if I had to do it again I would definitively go for the Black. Unless all you shoot is 1080P60FPS there is not enough a price difference to give up the extra resolution and burst speed.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: laura
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT but I just don't love that we have to buy all of this accesories for it to great (all of this mounts, lcd monitor, extra batteries, chargers, lens protector, microsd, etc.) And also, that if you left the battery in it, even though the camera is off, it will be consumed. But after all is really great, (pictures aren't thaaat great... no vibration reduction).

Reviews.Title: GoPro HERO3
Reviews.Author: Linda Eddy
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my husband for Christmas.  He has already used it on kayaking trips and seems to really like it.  I think especially because he can show it on our TV instead of the computer screen.

Reviews.Title: this camera is very good.
Reviews.Author: gegassen
Reviews.Content: I and my family used this camera in the beach. We used during the last weekend and got many many photos.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my son, who loves it
Reviews.Author: Fallbrook Avocados "Bill"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to my son.  He uses it for underwater and swimming shots as well as strapped to our graddaughter's bicycle.  He sends us some great videos he has taken.  The video quality is surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality.
Reviews.Author: Andrei Muraru
Reviews.Content: Best camera ever! The quality is amazing and in very difficult conditions it works perfectly providing excellent scenes. Amazon delivered this very quickly and we could already enjoy a lot of great moments.

Reviews.Title: Can't wait to put it on the motorcycle!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love it, great product, does what it says, got the handle bar mount as well, can't wait for Sturgis this year!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, BUT
Reviews.Author: Andres Eloy Hernandez "acr30"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, but I cant understand how difficult is to start the download of the firmware.Is it so hard to make a friendly interface anticipating the browsers problems about plugins and extensions?Please, Im not talking about a small business, ITS GOPRO, INC.

Reviews.Title: Hubby's birthday.
Reviews.Author: Beths
Reviews.Content: Got this for the Hubby for his birthday.  He's been after me a while for one and I decided to get the newest one out there, in hopes that it would be the best.  He's still learning all the ins and outs, but so far he's loved the compactness of the camera and how rugged it seems to be.  We are loving the movies he's taking from his fishing trips.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, limited use.
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: So we bought this camera, and loved it for our beach adventures.  But we just didn't find ourselves using it very often.  It's just niche enough that we couldn't justify keeping it.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Daniel Brigido
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera! Perfect for filming adventures. I had lots lots lots lots lots lots lots and of course, lots of fun with it!

Reviews.Title: Capturing questionable moments is now effortless
Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: Love the GoPro, use it more than I thought I would. Gets pricey buying all the various attachments, straps, etc... but well worth it. YOLO!

Reviews.Title: Good video
Reviews.Author: hookjockey
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use this device.  I wish it came with more mounting options.  They really get you with the after market add ons.  I also wish there were a way to turn off the fish eye nature of the lens.  Other than that it seems pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Audry
Reviews.Content: My fiancé LOVES his gopro that I got him! He has used it every time he goes riding and can't wait to hook it up to watch the videos!

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Fernando Valdivia
Reviews.Content: Excelent camera, realy good definition, very firm and durable. A lot of accesories for all sports i love. Completed my spectations!!

Reviews.Title: Go Pro is Better than Great!!
Reviews.Author: Eileen P
Reviews.Content: Fabulous fun camera to own.  The first trial run was done when my son in law strapped it to the train under the Christmas tree.  It was so much fun to see what the view of the room was from the floor.  We can hardly wait for warmer weather to have more action shots.

Reviews.Title: STEEZE-NUTZ
Reviews.Author: Jake McAteer
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about cameras, or frame rates, or any of that. Some would call me a fool for buying such a nice camera without being fully aware of its  potential. I'm just a lowly skateboarder, who wanted simple documentation of pure stoke and steeze. I definitely got what I paid for, and so much more. This thing is simply awesome. Stick a mount to anything, get the rad footy, make an edit, GET PUSSY. Simple as that folks.In all seriousness. Selection of frame rates are great. I prefer 720p 60fps for that dank slo-mo. Picture quality is beyond amazing. Better than actually being there. Battery life is OK, I plan on getting extra batteries though. Also, wifi is choppy in the cold. Other than that, 100% pleased. Amazon shipped it really fast too.

Reviews.Title: Gopro hero 3 white
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and if you do some video editing you can make the camera look like a hero black

Reviews.Title: Great HD action cam.
Reviews.Author: TheMountainMan "TheMountainMan"
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. When it comes to HD action cams, there clearly is no other choice.  This edition came back with many options.  Want to try the 4K, but was disappointed it is only 10 frames per second.  Still a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy, just in time for the honeymoon! :)
Reviews.Author: Clay Sloan "Chocolater"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great addition to our honeymoon. The mounts are easy to use and since GoPro is such a popular name, a lot of adventure companies have equipment with the mounts for people who own GoPro's or want to rent them for tours. The battery life seems good and appropriate. It is easy to get additional batteries and swap them out as needed. Very easy operation and it got used a lot. Snorkeling, zip-lineing , downhill mountain bikeing, jungle hike etc. The movies are easy to see and preview with the app for the ipad. When you get them downloaded onto the PC man they look great and the 1080p 60fps really shines. Also while I didn't experiment with them too much the extra settings are nice to have if you have a variety of shots you would like to capture.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera/ video recorder AND so small too!
Reviews.Author: Eric A. Hofstetter
Reviews.Content: I have found this new GoPro HERO3+ Silver Edition to be loads of fun! It takes great pictures.  Makes awesome videos.  I have gone out of my way and purchased the headstrap and quick clip for it as well.  The app on my iPhone controls all functions of the GoPro and is a lot of fun! The BackPac back LCD which is pricey would also be a nice extra too!  Overall, I like it a lot.  The only thing I don't like is I had a full charge, and turned it off (at least I thought it was completely off) and now this morning it is dead.  So, either I'm doing something wrong (which I probably am), or there is some sort of a glitch.

Reviews.Title: Finally a GoPro that I use on a regular basis!
Reviews.Author: Rick Strahl
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. I've had earlier versions of the GoPro, which ended up gathering dust, but between the super hi-res image/video quality and remote control, this one is getting used all the time. I especially enjoy capturing video and picking out individual frames which are full picture quality with barely any noticable blurring even for things like windsurfing or biking.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Costumer SeRvice and Crapy product
Reviews.Author: Nicolas
Reviews.Content: I got a GOPRO 3+ Black Edition. It was just a nightmare and a waste of money and time. The camera basically does not work, it freezes and the image turned to greenish/pinkish after the first video I was able to make. They, after asking a bunch of question, decided I was not under the warranty, so I just waste a lot of money, and time. I guess you have to be lucky to get one that it does work. If you want it...it is a risky purchase...

Reviews.Title: Wow, garbage.
Reviews.Author: Chuck Steak
Reviews.Content: Bought into this big time. I bought the mounts, batteries, high speed cards, you name it. Big mistake. I spend a lot of money on my equipment and expect a lot back. This camera does not deliver.Buy this only if you can't get the shot any other way, and with another camera.The truth is that with Delkin mounts and a decent camcorder, you can get most of the shots, albeit, with a larger form factor.I read so many good things about this camera and have concluded that these people are inexperienced and just backing their mistake up with subjective nonsense.Hate the physical controls (or lack thereof), hate the cell phone control app (slow, delayed and unusable), hate the proprietary mounts, and most of all hated the quality. (Noisy, poor low light performance, cloudy, poor auto exposure, focusing issues, just garbage.)I shoot my active kids, friends and motorcycle rides with my new camcorder. It looks great, is easier to use, and I have industry standard mounts and quick releases for almost any situation and that fit all of my cameras. There are alternatives to crappy sport cameras, look into it.

Reviews.Title: The Hero 3+ Black has worthwhile refinements
Reviews.Author: Westifer
Reviews.Content: Trying to decide on a Hero 3, I was happy to learn about the recent release of the 3+.  I have listed and graded the improvements for people trying to decide if this is for you!I thought I would score some of the items I was trying to understand before I bought this camera, to assist those who are trying to decide if it is the right camera for them.  This is what I thought was important:The instructions are a bit abbreviated for a first time user, but they are accurate.  B+ for that!The wireless connections are faster and dependable. A+ for that!The photos are sharper and appear to have better color saturation.  A+ for that!The battery does last a little longer.  B+ for that!The Menus remain a minor nuisance to learn and navigate, but are consistent and dependable.  B for that.The Wifi performance to Phone or Tablet is awesome for viewing high def playback, or (almost) live viewing.  A+ for that!The Sound quality is improved, and is less compromised (but still diminished) when waterproof case is used.  B+ for that!The camera still cannot be externally powered while in the waterproof case (desirable for time lapse).  C for that.The GoPro apps for tablet and phone are good, but not awesome.  B+ for that!The GoPro Studio app for editing is good, but not intuitive. And hey, it's free! B+ for that!The mounts included are a good selection, very secure, and others are readily available.  A+ for that!The size is even smaller than previous models, and mounts easily.  A+ for that!The GoPro community has many active web sites, and there are some great tips and tricks out there!  A+ for that!Overall, if you are looking for the current best sports camera out there, I feel very comfortable recommending this model for $400.

Reviews.Title: Make Sure You have double checked housing that it is properly sealed
Reviews.Author: Ricardo L. Larrabure
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product with the headstrap, arm band, floaty etc so was ready to go diving in Tahiti. On the first dive, not down over 30 feet, the camera housing leaked water and the camera was totally fried. $500 out the window. I had opened the housing to put the camera in so I do not know if it was a faulty housing or a problem I created. Regardless, be EXTREMELY careful before going into the water with what looks to be a great device.

Reviews.Title: Broken on day 3?!?
Reviews.Author: Dana D. Persons
Reviews.Content: We had fun with it for 2 of the 3 days skiing.  Found out it only plays back with VLC media player (only audio plays back on Windows media player).  Day 3 it quit midday on the slopes and won't charge, turn on, nor download to the computer. Now what?!?!  Any clues what to do?!?

Reviews.Title: Issue for blurriness in photos/ video
Reviews.Author: Joseph Woznica "Wozztography"
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to give some insight on what is truly happening with the blurred backgrounds users are experiencing. As stated in the description, it is an f 2.8-6.0 lens that the new go pro uses. For those of you who have no idea what I'm talking about, here's what it means: Those numbers are whats called an aperture. That is a set of elements within the lens to determine how much light goes to the sensor. With a camera such as this, the changes to aperture occur as the lighting conditions change, unlike a DSLR where you control that manually. The change I'm talking about is the aperture opening and closing. At f/2.8, The depth of field, or amount of focus in your image is much smaller than at f/6. When the scene is super bright, your aperture will automatically be set at f/2.8, when its a bit darker perhaps f/6. So why does all of that matter? Some of you have reported that while you focus on something close, such as handlebars, your background has gone blurry ( thats called bokeh, its actually considered artistic). It's all about where you place the focus of your video which uncontrollably is related to how much light enters your scene. If you go into the settings of your go pro, you'll find a shooting setting called spot meter, that will allow you to select how much light enters your frame by focusing on one specific spot of your frame.

Reviews.Author: GSDLover "GSDLover"
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this thing.  We purchased it because we travel a lot.  This past weekend we did a Color Run in Las Vegas and took it with us. The protective casing kept all the dust out, and only one small section on the protective case needed to be wiped with the QTip.  Make sure to look at the video options too....we downloaded the app for our tablet (GoPro has its own wifi network you can connect to) and we watched the videos immediately afterwards (a little choppy, but we attributed that to the wifi between the two because at home on the PC when downloaded they were fine).  Saved us bringing the laptop on vacation with us!  We highly suggest investing in the remote accessory - it was a bit annoying to keep readjusting the unapod to restart the camera, and in the sunlight it was a bit hard to see the camera display.  The remote saved this for us.  The app has it too, but given the conditions we didn't want our phone/tablet getting dirty.  Highly suggest the camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice features and fantastic video quality
Reviews.Author: Jacx "J.C."
Reviews.Content: We own four models of GoPro. Still use them all, each time something improves yet also lose some things, like interchangeable cases, battery life being the biggest loss.With the Hero 3 we had/have some freezing up issues and over heating, well the camera is hot to touch. With the Hero3+ we have not had those issues so far, been using in a month now and noticeably cooler weather then the summer use of the Hero 3. I love the wide view, beautiful better than life video quality; can even make the mighty Mississippi mud water look good enough to swim in. I find the app delay almost the same as the Hero3 maybe a half second shaved off, yet its still a great thing to be able to go on the Iphone or Ipad and change settings, preview video or watch what you already have, even transfer over and email clips.I much prefer the new lock latch over the Hero 3 two-step latch. Came with a slightly bigger battery, I don’t mean physical size but is 1,180 mAh. A lot of our pre owned accessories work; I am adding the quick clip, and the standard tripod mount, got both for less than thirty on Amazon.  If I were to get to change anything, I would go back to the slightly bigger body and put in a longer life battery because battery life still sucks.When I am kayaking I forget to check and have lost over half my rides. Biggest thing is adding a small button battery would take care of the time date stamp needing to be reset after the battery is dead.

Reviews.Title: The View from Up Top
Reviews.Author: Technology Guy
Reviews.Content: First off, I wish GoPro had included instructions on how to free the HERO3+ from its diabolical puzzle box packaging.This camera presents a very different type of photography than I'm used to (namely, wearing the camera rather than holding it). And, unfortunately, the weather hasn't cooperated in terms of field testing. Apologies aside, this is one slick little device. As someone who likes to take control of the photographic process, the GoPro HERO3+ Black has some great options in terms of remote control. The camera settings can be changed using the camera's 3 buttons but it also includes a small rechargeable keyfob style WiFi remote that lets you change all the settings, shoot photos, start and stop video recording and, importantly check the current settings and status on the remote's small LCD screen. Even better, there's a smartphone app for it that gives you a great interface for remote control. In order to use a smartphone, you'll need to turn on the camera's battery-draining Wifi and set your smartphone to connect to the camera's password protected Wifi network. Using an Android Samsung Galaxy SIII, I could not only see the current settings and status but also monitor what the camera was seeing. The video you see on phone's screen lags by a second or two, however, so you'll need to anticipate any still shots and use burst mode. With the smartphone app, you can also view, download and delete previously recorded videos and stills, a very nice feature.The camera, waterproof case and remote seem very well-made. As for the kit, it would have been nice if the camera had included a clamping mount instead of two different types of stick-on mounts. The package sadly also does not come with a micro-HDMI cable or adapter to view video and images on your HD TV. There are two USB cables for charging the remote and camera and to access to video and photo files as well as a Quick Setup guide and full manual. GoPro recommends a class 10 micro-SD card for the HERO3+, also not included.During hands-on testing, video looked very smooth with pretty good quality on a laptop screen. Stills were also pretty good once I switched on Auto White Balance. Switching to the smartphone app remote was a bit frustrating at first since it takes more than simply running the app to connect to the camera. I hope to test HD and ultra-HD video in more detail and post an update as time and weather permits. So far, I'm rather impressed with the sophistication of the HERO3+.

Reviews.Title: Significant improvement from last year's Hero3, but wait for Hero4
Reviews.Author: Gearhead Mania
Reviews.Content: The Hero3+ Black Edition is an updated version of last year's Hero3 Black Edition. Just reading some of the reviews for the 2012 Black Edition, there are a significant number of complaints about the GoPro overheating, locking up, or overall performing poorly. It seems that with the latest firmware update and/or an "Extreme" speed micro SD card (Such as the SanDisk Extreme or Samsung Pro microSDXC), the 2012 Black Edition works better. However, out of the box, the Hero3+ Black Edition works great.I never experienced any overheating, lockups, or other problems. I use a dedicated wall charger for charging the battery (Belkin 2A fast charge unit), and a Samsung Pro 64GB microSDXC that allows the GoPro to record at 45 Mbps bitrate w/ ProTune enabled. The battery life at 1080P/60fps, WiFi Remote On, Protune On = 1 hour 42 minutes. This isn't the most ideal battery life, but it is close to the runtime for my Hero3 Silver in 1080P/30 fps w/o ProTune.Reading some of the other reviews for the Hero3+ Black Edition, I noticed many complaining about the new optics not having true infinity focus. This is something I noticed as well, but I do not have the 2012 Black Edition to compare. I just figured it was the same for all GoPro models since my Hero3 Silver does the same thing, as does the Sony Action Cam. However, watching YouTube videos of side-by-side comparisons between the Hero3 Black and Hero3+ BLack, I personally couldn't tell much of a difference other than the Hero3 Black being a bit sharper and crisper when examining screen captures up close. The 2012 Black Edition was still blurry with distance shots, not even close to the videos my Samsung Galaxy S3 takes.I also learned that VLC Media Player (or another brand) is recommended for playing back videos recorded with the GoPro, mainly because Windows Media Player can't seem to handle the higher bitrate of the footage. I first encountered this problem with my Sony Action Cam with Firmware 2.0 which allowed 1080P 60fps footage. So I recommend downloading and using VLC media player for playback. A fast computer is also a good idea, because my Dell Core 2 Duo laptop from 2008 was incapable of smoothly playing back the 1080P 60fps video files. My desktop PC (AMD Phenom II X3 720 w/ Radeon HD 4850) was capable of playing back the videos and even editing them.The packaging is the same as last year's Hero3, which is a royal pain to open. But the Black Edition comes with some extra goodies, namely the WiFi remote control, a keyring for the remote, and charging cable for the remote. The display bracket for the remote was a pain to remove as well. The mount design is the same as previous GoPro models, and I always had issues with the mounts coming loose no matter how tight I turn the thumbscrew. In this instance, I did not have any problems. However, if it does loosen up, I recommend rosin (the stuff they use to secure rifle scopes in rings, or for gymnasts to increase grip) in the grooves.The Hero3+ still uses a mini-USB port for charging, which is interesting given that practically all smartphones, cameras, and tablets have adopted micro-USB as the new standard. The WiFi remote has its own charging cable with a proprietary attachment at the remote itself. When using the remote control, there is noticeable lag between control inputs and the display updates.The Hero3+ Black Edition comes with a slightly larger battery (1180 mAh vs. the older 1050 mAh), which is only a 12% increase in capacity. The other 18% improvement in battery life must have come from improved firmware/hardware. I observed a battery life of 1 hour 42 minutes with WiFi Remote Control, continuous recording, 1080P 60fps, and ProTune, which is actually very good. I remember with my Hero3 Silver that I was only able to get about 2 hours 10 minutes with 1080P 30fps without ProTune.I evaluated my Hero3+ Black Edition first with a SanDisk Ultra 32GB microSDHC card that is rated at Class 10 / UHS 1, but as well all know the SanDisk Ultra line is not on the GoPro recommended list for running the full 45 Mbps bitrate with ProTune.  I also used a Samsung Pro 64GB microSDXC card. That said, my Hero3+ Black Edition was stable with the SanDisk Ultra card (which only writes at around sequential 9 MB/s according to CrystalDiskMark) but I was limited to 35 Mbps bitrate in ProTune mode. I upgraded to a Samsung Pro 64GB microSDXC card that is on GoPro's list of recommended cards, mainly because it is half the price of the SanDisk Extreme microSDXC card and about the same price as the SanDisk Ultra 64GB card. The Samsung Pro writes at 15.62 MB/s in the same benchmark, and I was creating videos at 45-47 Mbps in ProTune mode in 1080P 60fps, 1440, 2.7k, and 4k modes. So the first thing I'd recommend is purchasing one of the SD cards on the GoPro recommended list just to have a faster card and ensure smooth operation of the GoPro.I had several complaints with last year's Hero3 editions. First, the microphone and audio recording was abysmal. I'd hear a distorted/crackling noise when recording inside a car that others have experienced and could never resolve. The audio always sounded muffled and poor. Watching any YouTube video or even professional videos on TV that used GoPros, I could easily tell that it was recorded using the built-in mic. However, the Hero3+ Black fixes all of these problems. I no longer hear that crackling noise in the car, even with the skeletonized door. While riding my bicycle in 30 mph winds with the skeletonized door, I do not hear wind noise. The mic picks up the sound of my car engine just fine, and can even pick up the radio playing at a low volume. It is actually better than the microphones on my Sony Action Cam. The GoPro mic now has better audio range with no distortion.The menu system is the same as last year's Hero3, which is still slow and cumbersome to use when you know the setting you want is about 30 clicks away. The LEDs are still very bright and grabs too much attention when filming at night. There are only 3 settings for the LEDs: all 4 on, 2 on, and all off. The problem is that the front LED is always on unless you turn all of them off. What I'd like to see is having the option of only keeping a rear LED on. In addition, having the blue WiFi (for the GoPro app) LED and red recording LED on when attached to the front of your windshield could attract unnecessary attention because red and blue lights on the front of your vehicle are generally authorized only for emergency vehicles.Low light recording is pretty good compared to other similar action cams. However, that is not saying much. With ProTune enabled, there is an excessive amount of noise in low light conditions even with the auto Low Light feature enabled. The noise is similar to using too high of an ISO for film or digital shots. In nighttime recordings on streets without ambient light (and say, just your headlight), the darkness is excessively noisy. The option is to turn ProTune off, or to keep ProTune on and adjust it in post processing.The field of view settings are the same: narrow is about 90 degrees and almost gives an unmodified view of the world. Medium is a good compromise probably around 120 degrees, while Wide has obvious distortions at the edges. The new SuperWide setting is very cool and artistic for those special shots. The narrow setting has the least distortion, so it is what I found to be most useful for onboard footage of motorcycles and cars at the race track, but medium isn't bad either and gives a slightly wider view to capture corners, etc...The GoPro optics aren't really designed for distance acuity. They are designed primarily to focus at close ranges, basically taking selfies as you parachute into a volcano or from outer space. The optics are akin to a near-sighted person going outside without glasses. Objects are sharp about 1 car length ahead. Beyond that, things get blurry but not too bad. Just don't expect to count blades of grass.In terms of video quality, I'd pick my FujiFilm XP200 and Samsung S3 smartphone over the GoPro. The S3 has image stabilization and in 1080P/30fps mode, the video quality is just significantly better. It will allow you to see objects clearly farther ahead. The problem is the S3 isn't as durable as the GoPro, and the XP200 is bulky. The S3 for some reason records with almost no compression artifacts but its optics are able to pick up objects farther away, all with a smaller bitrate.If you opt to turn ProTune off with the Hero3+ Black Edition, I observed compression artifacts on objects like grass, when driving by them at speed. The Sony Action Cam is also notorious for doing this. With ProTune turned on, the footage looked much better.The rolling shutter effect was a major problem with the Hero3 Silver Edition, mainly because of the 30fps speeds. I had the same issue with the Sony Action Cam prior to the firmware update. The 60 fps frame rate is necessary for any type of action footage, it greatly mitigates the rolling shutter effect, and the footage just looks spectacular. Others have recommended the 720p 120fps mode because it doesn't sacrifice much video quality but the faster frame rate is smoother. With the Hero3+ Black in 60 fps, there wasn't any noticeable rolling shutter effect.What I'd still like to see in the future: The GoPro still lacks image stabilization which makes it a poor choice on high-vibration environments such as being mounted directly on the frame of a road bike or motorcycle. Rumor is that the Hero4 will have image stabilization, or at least the Hero4 will be using a video engine that is capable of image stabilization. As-is, the Hero3+ will work fine mounted on the windshield of a car (which has a better suspension system and vibration damping than a rigid aluminum road bike). The video optics could also be improved. Given the fact my Samsung Galaxy S3 has a much smaller camera with only 8MP capability, the S3 still takes clearer pictures and videos than the GoPro.Overall: 4/5 stars, this is what the 2012 Hero3 Black Edition should have been. GoPro fixed the audio quality issues and the performance issues appear to have been resolved, it also helps to use a fast SD card. As a result, I give the Hero3+ Black Edition a high recommendation if you're interested in taking action footage, but it is very expensive for what it is. The video quality blows away the Sony Action Cam, but it is also durable enough to be used in many environments while the Galaxy S3 is really just a fragile smartphone.However, I'd say wait for the Hero4. It should have image stabilization, improved optics that are clearer at all distances, and even better battery life.

Reviews.Title: A lot of improvements to the HD Hero2 Outdoor
Reviews.Author: Vyshtia
Reviews.Content: I am upgrading from the HD Hero2 Outdoor Edition camera.  My main complaints with that camera was:1.  It was horrible with wind noise.  I bought the Furry Windscreen which helped, but there was still a lot of wind noise.2.  There is no way to see what your filming.  I bought the LCD BacPac to fix this problem, adding to my expense.3.  Sometimes it would have a hard time focusing - you can see it would "search" and then try to focus.This new model addresses all of the issues above.  This one deals with wind noise better.  You can now sync it with your iPhone so you can control and see what you're filming in real time.  This is a HUGE plus!!  I wonder if the whole issue with the soft background is how they thought they would correct the original focusing problem of the Hero2.  I know this is a big complaint among many users and it's a deal-breaker to some.  I didn't have too much of an issue with it on my camera.  I'm not picky on my picture quality as some, I suppose.  The up close stuff is so clear and bright and it's not having that focus-search issue anymore that I'm happy with it for my uses.  I also know that it's hard to have a small camera that is going to be perfect for everything up close AND everything far away too.  I'm sure they'll figure out a way to get this fixed soon...but as it is, this is already really darn good.  This camera is smaller, lighter, thinner and has many mounting options so it's definitely improving on being more "wearable".  This "Black" version is the best of the Hero 3's and highly recommended.  I reserve the 5 stars for when it becomes truly "perfect" fixing the soft background picture quality, but this is definitely a recommended product.

Reviews.Title: Improved in Many Ways.
Reviews.Author: A*
Reviews.Content: I have the previous edition of the GoPro, I enjoy it. The GoPro is a great little gadget. I use it to film my rides and attach it to my dog during his trials for competitions. What I like about the GoPro Hero3+ is that the colors are warmer and everything is a bit sharper, more defined. This may not be enough for folks who have the previous model, I admit that would cause me to hesitate if I were making an impulse purchase but reviewing my footage at home -- it is worth it. The overall warming of images just reads as a better quality image, but that depends on the person's eyes that are viewing said footage. Also, another advantage of the new model is that during night shoots the color is better. And overall audio quality is leaps ahead of the previous model as well.When taking the aforementioned into account, if you don't have the Hero 3 go for the Hero 3+, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah Roth
Reviews.Content: I have this camera. Black edition. I want to love this camera, just like I want to love anything I spend around $500 on (camera, plus a few accessories) but I just can't. I could gripe about the BAD battery life, which is another star off, but what really needs to be mentioned here is the lens issue that many others have quoted. I just used this camera to record a piano cover for a friend. The camera sat on a non moving mount, less than 5 feet from a non moving piano. All of the keys outside of the 4' threshold that others have mentioned are flat out blurry. 1080p setting, great lighting, the subject in question is not moving, nor is the camera, and the quality blows, I haven't even uploaded it to Youtube yet so you can't say that the internet compression hurt the quality. This video was edited using the software off of GoPro's website and under their high quality preset with protune on and all of that jazz. My galaxy note 3 takes higher quality stand still video than this does. You're going to say, "yeah, this camera isn't meant for that type of filming", but the fact of the matter is, while you ARE correct, that doesn't mean that anything farther away than 4' should be horribly out of focus.Don't buy this. Buy the Hero 3 Black instead, as this doesn't have the new and "improved" lens. The + is garbage.The video in question will be uploaded to my Youtube page shortly. Search "jeremiah roth piano", and look at any of the previous cover videos in order to compare the sharpness. I'm not self promoting, just showing comparison. I'll upload a screen shot if I can so you don't need to expend the extra effort.I'm going to Belize to SCUBA dive the great hole in the summer, I don't feel I can trust this product to last through the day and shoot in the quality that I had hoped I'd receive. I'll never buy a GoPro again. I wanted to love this product. But can't.

Reviews.Title: Great sport/action video camera!
Reviews.Author: H. Dinh "shooter"
Reviews.Content: The name GoPro said it all. Construction quality, usability are top notched and video quality is awesome! I have a Hero 3 Black edition that I used on my bike, but now the new version will take it place.The most significant improvments for the 3+ are all of its WiFi capabilities. This could save you over a hundred dollars in accessories in additional improved usability. For example, framing your picture with the old Hero3 is pretty tedious with trial and errors. It would help if you have video back ($75), otherwise you will do a lot of mounting and dismounting, load and test the video with your laptop. Th 3+ allows you to use your smart phone to frame your picture with an app downloaded from the appstore. This app also can be used to trigger your 3+ using Wifi. This alone separates the 3 from 3+, IMHO.Video quality is what you would expect from action videocam; wide angle and supports most resolution from VGA to 1080p high definition. It could also be used as a digital camera in a pinch with 10MP resolution. If you are considering this camera, find out more of its features at the GoPro website. while you are there, check out the wonderful videos made with this camera.One good thing is all of the Hero3 accessories also work with 3+ including the weatherproof case, so upgrading from Hero3 is a bit less painful. For the new users, it is a bit steep to pay for the camera. But if you make the purchase, this video cam will meet your adventure needs for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Trust but verify
Reviews.Author: T.A. Kisyak
Reviews.Content: Camera is probably fine had the casing not failed it.My first fault was in not testing the waterproof casing before first use in the real world. But then, neither did I have a doubt in GoPro's quality assessment procedures, nor there were instructions on how to test the casing at home. It's not hard for most obvious kinds of flaws: submerging closed empty case in water (sink or tub) with temperature different from that of the ambient air would do the trick, if it's flawed, it will either almost instantaneously start emitting bubbles (in colder water), or, much more slowly, will start letting the water in.I did not do that, and to my terror, the $500+ assembly of camera, memory card, monopod, and mount came unraveling on the first snorkel dip. Less than 15 minutes in, I noticed salt water inside the housing and rushed ashore, sea urchins under my feet notwithstanding.My second fault was contacting GoPro's customer service. After 20 minutes waiting for my call to be picked up (granted, it was Saturday morning), they understood and were willing to replace the device given the failure. Except, even after receiving a video demonstrating the housing flaw, the best recourse they could promise was an approximate 15 day turnaround from the day I send damaged gear back. My point about having bought the camera specifically for the (understandably short) vacation I was on fell on deaf ears. Although there was at least one GoPro shop on the island, they wold not offer to replace faulty gear right away, and my request over email to escalate the case was just ignored.Enter Amazon. Upon returning home 7 days after the ordeal (that in no small degree spoiled my tropical vacation), they answered my call with no wait time at all (at 8 p.m. Pacific on Tuesday), listened to my story, and in 10 minutes a UPS return label was in my email inbox. Full refund, no further questions. Bravo, Amazon! I am still stuck with unwanted monopod and memory card that cost me $100+, but eventually I'll put them to use.Just not with GoPro gear, I'm afraid.
